title: Operations Engineer, Robotics
description:
* Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or other STEM field
* 4+ years of experience as a Project Engineer, Process Engineer, Project Manager, Manufacturing Engineer, or related occupation
* Experience managing the lifecycle of cross-functional projects, implementing automated equipment and/or integrated systems
* Experience with CAD software (AutoCAD, REVIT, BIM 360, etc.)
* Experience supporting deployment of new product/technology and/or large material handling and automation installations in a construction environment to include safety and permitting requirements.


As an Operations Engineer, you will lead and manage the lifecycle of challenging cross-functional projects, developing and delivering the next generation of automation and material handling solutions. You are a customer obsessed leader that will play an integral part in planning and implementation of the facility network infrastructure including new builds, retrofits, expansions and program initiatives. Partnering with internal customers and internal/external stakeholders to engage as a team and ensure a timely handover will be part of your critical tasks.
  
  

As an Operations Engineer for Amazon, you will work with some of the most talented engineers in the design, development, and delivery of physical distribution systems around the globe. You are responsible for managing a technology or integration project, successfully delivering the solution to meet project goals. You may work directly with external equipment vendors, customers, or partners, and you have a solid understanding of the design approaches and industry technologies utilized in fulfillment and distribution center designs. To meet timelines and minimize disruption to support teams, you manage the overall schedule, proactively mitigate risks, and keep the scope of engineering deliverables under control.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Work independently with internal and external teams to successfully manage the lifecycle of challenging projects, and act as owner in delivering on project objectives and targets. Projects may span organizations or geographies in support of business objectives.
* Actively participate in firm engineering reviews, and make tangible impact on the proposed solutions on an individual system or its components, on the overall systems architecture, and on facility processes.
* Partner with internal teams, stakeholders and external vendors to set project priorities, establish milestones, and drive schedules to meet deadlines. Proactively assess stakeholders’ dependencies and milestones, problem-solve and drive solutions to mitigate the impact from the issues.
* Lead and coordinate all execution efforts in delivering systems and automated equipment designs per established standards and guidelines. Perform equipment/system installation, throughput and safety qualifications. Simplify, optimize, remove bottlenecks and provide feedback while resolving difficult system problems or technical deficiencies.
* Lead effective meetings by setting the objectives, putting the right people in the room and driving detailed business and technical discussions/alignment. Document meeting discussions, decisions and future steps, ensuring alignment on expectations with internal partner teams and outside vendors.
* Promptly and accurately communicate project status, risk analysis and risk mitigation plans. Effectively answer project questions in detail, and regularly produce clear and concise summaries for the project to leadership/management team.
* Competently articulate system and/or equipment designs, including layouts, technical specifications and functional capabilities to internal customers and partner teams.
* Support change order controls, purchase orders, and invoice validation/approvals.
* Excel at building strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders across multiple projects.
* Identify and lead process improvement initiatives that improve the Engineering and cross-teams’ efficiencies, optimizing the teams’ value and delivery. Through collaboration, generate high-quality, cost-effective solutions in compressed periods of time.
* Travel 30% - 80% domestically although travel intensity can be variable and consist of up to three weeks in a row, including weekends.


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Arlington, VA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Nashville, TN, USA | Virtual Location - USA
  
  

* Master’s degree in Engineering, Operations, Business Administration, or a related STEM field
* Operations Management/Distribution Center experience with direct management or responsibility for material handling, automation, or other technical projects
* Experience with Six Sigma and/or Lean Manufacturing
* Experience with Microsoft Project, Smartsheet programs
* Experience with new product introduction and/or implementation automation solutions, such as Conveyors, Sorters, high speed manufacturing and packaging lines, Robotic work cells
* Proven technical leadership for industrial engineering projects or program


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $61,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $126,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Calibration Engineer
description:
About this role: • Calibration Engineer works within the area of Metrology. The role will support with the management of calibration and metrology program. The role will also work cross functionally and will collaborate with Technical Experts, Project Managers, Case Management, Product Managers, Regulatory, Quality Assurance and others to ensure alignment and that content is correct and approved. This can by a hybrid or remote role and is part of a global team. In this role you will: • Work with calibration leads to assess data for measurements of uncertainty for field-based and depot based calibrations. • Develop and write protocols and procedures, especially relating to uncertainty measurements and other calibration good governance requirements, to standardize calibration operating and remediation procedures globally. • Work with calibration leads to drive global compliance with applicable industry standards (ISO/IEC 17025; NIST). • Asses current calibration test and measurement protocols and procedures documentation and address compliance to industry best practices and standards. • Read, understand, and follow documentation and department procedures, including global procedures • Ensure that skills are maintained on a continual basis to support QS activities and objectives, and participate in process improvement efforts • Adhere to the company’s Style Guide, terminology guidelines, and relevant best-practice guidelines • Provide support for the Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs processes that the team adheres to. • Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure accuracy and completeness of content. • Revise and update documentation as needed to reflect changes in product features or functionality. • Apply established standards and best practices to ensure uniformity and quality The essential requirements of the job include: • Must have expertise in measurements of uncertainty to include data collection and calculation. • Experience of working in a global environment. • Excellent communication, writing, and grammar skills in the English language at the native-speaker level • Experienced user of Microsoft Office products • Ability to manage complex projects independently and collaborate with subject matter experts It would be a plus if you also have experience in the following: • Expertise in pressure measurement and Flow • Ability to prioritize work effectively and react appropriately in a dynamic work environment for completing deliverables on time • Ability to work and flourish in a diverse, multinational environment • Strong time management skills and ability to prioritize, balance varying demands, and meet deadlines. • Exceptional English and communication skills; able to transform complex information into concise, easy-to-understand content

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $56.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 6 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Resident Service Engineer - Greencastle, PA (Weekend Days)
description:
**Maintenance Technician - Greencastle, PA (100% On-Site)**


***6am-6pm Friday-Sunday***


**About Packsize**


Packsize is an automation company that enables more efficient and sustainable packaging process flows from packing to unboxing. We’re propelling our customers and the industry forward, always looking to innovate and improve. Because, to us, packaging is about much more than a box, it’s about delivering what’s right, for our customers, for their customers and our planet.


**About the Role**


We are looking for a highly skilled Maintenance Technician in the **Greencastle, PA area**. This Technician will work **on-site** at one of our Key Customers locations to install, maintain and support Packsize equipment as well as build and maintain customer relationships by effectively servicing the equipment. This individual must understand the needs of the customer, work proactively and efficiently to meet those needs, and provides 5-Star customer service by proactively visiting or calling the customer to ensure they are fully satisfied with the Packsize equipment, process flow, packaging designs, and service.


**What You'll Do**


* Work cross-functionally with R&D, Software and Quality Engineering teams
* Completes and successfully pass training courses
* Develops knowledge of Packaging Designs
* Learns and develops the customer support and technical skills necessary to perform high quality maintenance
* Performs preventive maintenance on machines, equipment and accessories
* Performs installation of new equipment and train Customer Personnel
* Learns and completes basic administration duties (assigned tasks, emails, etc.)
* Exposed to moving parts and electricity that require safety protocols
* Exposure to varied travel conditions either driving or flying
* Excellent work ethic and time management skills needed
* Must be accessible via telephone, and promptly return email and phone messages
* Travel by vehicle or airplane within assigned geography, overnight travel may be required


**What You'll Bring**


* Excellent Customer Service skills
* Basic Excel, Word skills
* Knowledge of Windows platforms
* Advanced mechanical skills
* Advanced troubleshooting skills to resolve equipment issues utilizing drawings, operational characteristics, and technical documentation
* Ability to learn troubleshooting and problem-solving procedures
* Able and willing to lift up to 50 lbs
* Ability to walk, climb, stand, carry materials, stoop, kneel, bend at waist
* Must be able to climb a ladder
* Exhibit mature, independent judgment with little or no direct supervision
* Effectively communicate through written and verbal reports to customer and direct supervision regarding worksite status
* **Good mechanical and troubleshooting skills**


* *The salary range for this role is* ***$68,000 USD - 78,000 USD (an additional 10% for 3rd shift differential)****; however, Packsize considers several factors when determining compensation when extending a job offer, including but not limited to, the role being offered, the associated responsibilities, the candidate's prior work experience, education/training, and any special skills.*


*Packsize is an Equal Opportunity employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In compliance with applicable federal and state laws, Packsize policy of equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran’s status, status as a qualified person with a disability, or genetic information. Individuals from historically underrepresented groups, such as minorities, women, qualified persons with disabilities and protected veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to qualified individuals with disabilities.*

title: Senior Project Scheduler
description:
**Job Title: Senior Project Scheduler - Aerospace Company** 

**Location: Tustin, CA (Remote/Onsite)**

**Targets: Aerospace / Defence companies** 

**Job Summary:** 

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Project Scheduler with experience in the aerospace industry to join our team in Orange County, CA. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and updating project schedules for complex aerospace projects, ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in project scheduling using Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project, with a strong background in the aerospace industry, and a Mechanical Engineering Degree.

**Requirements:** 

* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
* Must have at least three years of recent experience on P6.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in project scheduling, with a focus on the aerospace industry.
* Strong understanding of project management principles and processes.
* Extensive experience in project scheduling using Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project software.
* Ability to analyze and interpret project data identifies trends and issues, and recommends solutions.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
* Outstanding soft skills including leadership, conflict resolution, and negotiation skills.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Develop, maintain, and update project schedules using Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project software.
* Analyze resource utilization and availability to ensure effective resource planning and allocation.
* Monitor project progress and update project status reports, ensuring timely and accurate reporting to management.
* Identify and track project risks and develop risk mitigation strategies.
* Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure that project schedules and budgets are realistic and achievable.
* Participate in project planning and scheduling meetings to provide expert advice and guidance.
* Develop and maintain project control procedures and processes to ensure that project performance is measured consistently across all projects.
* Provide training and support to project teams on project control processes and tools.
* Ensure compliance with project controls policies and procedures.
* Participate in the development of proposals for new projects.
* Apply knowledge of earned value principles to develop project metrics, and analyze variances and trends.

**Preferred Qualifications:** 

* Master's or bachelor’s degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.
* Familiarity with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) regulations and guidelines related to the aerospace industry.
* Experience with earned value management (EVM) principles and practices.
* Familiarity with SAP or other project management software tools.
* Experience working with a manufacturer in the aerospace industry.

**Work Environment:**

* The Senior Project Scheduler will work in an office environment, and may also spend time on client sites or in manufacturing facilities, which may involve exposure to outdoor weather conditions, loud noises, and heavy machinery.
* This is an excellent opportunity for a highly experienced individual with strong project scheduling expertise using Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project to support our aerospace projects in Tustin, CA. If you meet the qualifications listed above and have outstanding soft skills, we encourage you to apply for this challenging and rewarding role in project controls.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* Primavera P6: 7 years (Required)
* Project scheduling: 8 years (Required)
* Microsoft Project: 5 years (Required)
* Aerospace: 5 years (Required)
* Defense: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer {REMOTE} - Data Center (Critical Facilities)
company: NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc.
description:
**Want to be a part of our team?**

As a Senior Mechanical Engineer at NTT Global Data Centers Americas, you will be a leader in the Technical Operations team, overseeing critical mechanical engineering projects and ensuring the high-performance operation of our data center facilities. Building on your extensive experience, you will lead and oversee complex mechanical engineering projects from concept to execution. Your technical expertise will be instrumental in providing guidance and mentorship to mid-level and entry-level mechanical engineers. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will drive continuous improvement and innovation in mechanical systems for data center infrastructure. In this senior role, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of our mechanical infrastructure and drive excellence in our data center operations.

**Working at NTT**

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

* Lead and oversee complex mechanical engineering projects, from concept to execution, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to mid-level and entry-level mechanical engineers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive continuous improvement and innovation in mechanical systems for data center infrastructure.
* Develop testing plans and corrective actions for optimization of data center equipment (CRAHs, CRACs, Chillers, AHUs, MAUs, humidifiers, etc.)
* Participate in review of client expansions and sales opportunities to ensure the standard data center design can support the contractual mechanical requirements (IT load densities, cooling requirements, deployment layout, airflow balance, SLAs, outages criteria, space monitoring)
* Establish efficiency targets and KPIs for data center equipment and systems.
* Stay informed about emerging trends and best practices in mechanical engineering and apply them to enhance our operations.
* Prepare and present technical reports and updates to senior management.
* Effectively communicate complex technical details to clients, providing insights into the normal and abnormal states of our mechanical infrastructure, ensuring a comprehensive understanding.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Demonstrate comprehensive and practical analytical skills to correctly identify the problem, determine the root cause, and provide sound business solutions.
* Ability to work independently on complex issues.
* In-depth expertise in mechanical systems, thermodynamics, and heat transfer principles.
* Proficient with Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations and analysis.
* Strong ability to optimize and fine-tune mechanical systems for maximum efficiency.
* Comprehensive understanding of data center infrastructure and its integration with mechanical systems.
* Leadership and mentorship skills for guiding junior engineers.
* Proficiency with Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, BlueBeam.

#GlobalDataCentersCareers

**What will make you a good fit for the role?**

**Education & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in mechanical engineering or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in data center or commercial HVAC engineering is preferred.

**Physical Requirements**

* Able to hear and speak on a telephone/videoconferencing.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate any required computer keyboard, mouse, and other technical instruments.
* Requires the ability to lift and carry objects weighing up to 20 pounds.

**Work Conditions**

* Work from home environment.
* Occasional visits to Data Center environments, which may be under construction for client builds, and subject to loud noises.
* Daily usage of a computer and/or workstation keyboards and terminals.

**Special Requirements**

* Occasional travel to company locations throughout the US approximately 10%
* Must be willing to occasionally work outside normal business hours, including weekends, late nights, and early mornings to maintain communication with our global partners and counterparts in the organization.

This is a remote position that requires reliable internet connection and electricity. A monthly stipend is provided to cover expenses associated with working remotely and use of a personal mobile device, if applicable.

NTT Global Data Centers Americas, Inc. offers competitive compensation based on experience, education, and location. Base salary for this position is $ 110,000 - $ 155,000.

All regular full-time employees are eligible for an annual bonus; payout is dependent upon individual and company performance.

Employees receive paid time-off, medical, dental, and vision benefits, life and supplemental insurance, short-term and long-term disability, flexible spending account, and 401k retirement plan to create a rich Total Rewards package.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

NTT is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $126,733.48 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
LRS Federal is a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned business which has been providing the federal government with engineering consulting services for 18 years. Offering a challenging and fast-paced work environment with ample opportunity to advance one's career, we seek employees with drive and tenacity.

  

LRS Federal is currently hiring an experienced Mechanical Engineer to support our portfolio of work with the US Department of Veterans Affairs, US Department of Agriculture, and the General Services Administration. The facilities to be supported by the mechanical engineer include hospitals, research spaces, office buildings, and administrative buildings. The type of engineering work will be varied and will include engineering investigations, mechanical design, construction phase services, and/or commissioning support.

  

Responsibilities of this role include:


* Mechanical Engineer on multi-discipline project teams.
* Lead the design and project delivery process on assigned projects.
* Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, or computer-generated reports.
* Design facility mechanical systems including water, chilled water, wastewater, HVAC, cooling towers/condensers, boiler/steam or hot water systems, compressed air, and other plumbing systems.
* Completion of engineering calculations and oversight of mechanical design using AutoCAD MEP. Revit experience or oversight is a plus.
* Assist engineers in system evaluation and application recommendations.
* Oversee the coordination and verification of project deliverables and adherence to company and client standards.
* Develop specifications, interface with on-site project teams.
* Observe installations.
* Excellent communication skills, interpersonal skills and ability to interact with our valued team members and clients.
* Excellent computer skills including AutoCAD, Revit, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word.

  



This position is offered as a remote position, but will require semi-annual travel to our headquarters office in Maryland and travel, as needed, to client sites across the United States. Travel is covered by the company.

  

This is a \\*Full-Time\\* position and includes a full benefits package including health, PTO, and 401(k). This position is an excellent opportunity to grow your career and to grow with our firm.

  

\\*Minimum Qualifications Include\\*:

* MUST possess a Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineer

* 6 years of experience in mechanical system design and construction with an A/E MEP company

* Professional Engineer registration preferred

* Commissioning experience preferred

* Proficiency in drafting software

* Ability to plan and organize tasks, establish and meet suspense dates, and create acceptable work products independent of supervision

* Ability to interact tactfully and diplomatically with others, have strong written and oral communication skills, and function under pressure due to intense project interest or time limitations

* Ability to handle complex projects requiring considerable creativity and judgment to resolve design problems, and assist in making decisions in situations where standard engineering methods, procedures, and techniques may not be applicable

  

LRS Federal is an equal-opportunity employer and was voted a "Best Places To Work" in 2023.

title: Project Engineer, Engineering, Planning and Solutions
description:
* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical/Industrial/Process Engineering or related STEM field
* 4+ years of experience in Design/Innovation, Research & Development, Manufacturing/Process/Industrial Engineering.
* Experience with complex MHE and packaging lines or process design based on Lean Manufacturing or Toyota Manufacturing System
* Experience using MS Excel, MS Project, and CAD software
* Experience leading engineering design projects and interacting with cross-functional teams


Amazon created one of the most sophisticated supply chains in the world. From the introduction of Amazon Prime, to the use of advanced technology for package delivery, Amazon consistently drives change from the front of the pack.
  
  

Amazon is seeking an experienced and detail oriented Project Engineer. This individual will deep-dive and challenge current processes, equipment, and procedures, in our North American fulfillment network, in order to come up with creative and implementable process improvement initiatives. This individual will also design development of new and existing fulfillment center layouts.
  
  

A successful candidate will have an established background in developing high-performance physical systems, a strong technical problem solving ability, excellent project management skills, and an internal motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment. Amazon’s culture encourages innovation and expects engineers and managers alike to take a high level of ownership in solving complex problems. The Project Engineer would be an agile natural self-starter with the ability to keep relentlessly driving projects and various functional teams and individuals at all levels of the organization in order to be successful.
  
  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Own the design and development of engineering solutions for complex material handling challenges considering human/equipment interactions for the North America fulfillment network
* Lead and coordinate concept and design development efforts for optimal solutions for the North America fulfillment network through equipment specification, material flow, process design, ergonomics, associate experience, operational considerations and site layout
* Work closely with vendors, suppliers and other teams to create innovative solutions
* Simultaneously manage multiple high-visibility projects and tasks while effectively influencing, negotiating, and communicating with internal and external business partners, contractors and vendors
* Conduct post mortem on designs after implementation in partnering with Safety and Operations
* Collaborate with the Fulfillment Center start-up team and launch team to ensure every detail is thought through and documented using a layout, module or Standard Operating Procedure and change control
* Develop, document and update design standards in conjunction with worldwide design teams
* Build strong working relationships with key company partners such as North America Start-up, North America Launch team, Worldwide Design team, North America Procurement, Information Technology, Loss Prevention, Facilities, Safety, Change Management and North America Operations
* Ability to travel up to 30% to interact with internal and external business and technical leaders


A day in the life
  
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
  
1. Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
  
2. Maternity and Parental Leave Options
  
3. Paid Time Off (PTO)
  
4. 401(k) Plan
  
  

If you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!
  
  

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Virtual Location - USA
  
  

* MBA, Master’s Degree or other advanced degree in Mechanical/Industrial/Process Engineering, Operations, Business Administration or related field and at least 5 years of progressively responsible experience in the specialty.
* Experience with complex automated material handling equipment, packaging technologies, and systems including robotics and high-speed manufacturing
* Proficiency in AutoCAD 3D
* Proficiency in using advanced simulation modeling tools (Flexsim, Arena, Simio, etc)
* Proficiency in running SQL queries and data mining
* Experience in engineering and estimating material handling and storage systems
* Operations Management/ Fulfillment/Distribution Center experience preferred
* Capital project management skills
* Proficiency with concepts like system architecture, optimization, system dynamics, system analysis, statistical analysis, reliability analysis, and decision making
* Design-in-Safety experience
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
* Ability to manage, influence, negotiate, and communicate with external business partners and internal teams to meet organizational capacity needs


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $62,700/year in our lowest geographic market up to $157,700/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Implementation Engineer | CPQ
description:
### **General information**

Office (s)
Remote, US
Date Published
Tuesday, March 5, 2024
Country
United States
Job ID
23896
Function
Professional Services
Recruiter
Olagbaju, Fehintola
Salary Range
50,000 - 140,000
### **Description & Requirements**

**Implementation Engineer | CPQ:** The Implementation Engineer is responsible for building custom user interfaces and advanced product rules that automate the design/quote process. You will be exposed to a full range of manufacturing products, from simple to very complex, that will need advanced configuration and pricing algorithms. You will use your enterprise software knowledge to dig deep into customer’s issues and goals, learn about their products and business processes, and then develop them a fully integrated solution. Solutions almost always involve other business systems (like ERP, CRM, CAD, etc) so a general knowledge of this space is critical. Your project team will include skilled mechanical engineers and programmers that solve bottlenecks in sales/engineering/manufacturing workflows. Your expertise will help them automate and accelerate processes for their custom products. You will be comfortable talking to customers and demoing your work in front of small audiences. Communication is paramount at Epicor CPQ. **What you will be doing:**

* Understand the customer’s business requirements and translate their needs into solutions.
* Develop and maintain custom configurator user interfaces.
* Develop and maintain advanced product configuration rules and advanced pricing algorithms.
* Traveling to customer sites to learn about customer products & business processes.
* Working with IT & engineering teams at customer sites to improve existing quote & design processes
* Interact with members of

cross-functional teams.  

* Identify issues and risks and report to the Project Manager with suggested direction.
* Ensure project deliverables are completed on time and anticipate issues or conditions that may impact the original estimate or project budget.
* Meet utilization targets and complete project deliverables on time.
* Demonstrate a high level of functional knowledge of the modules associated with their respective certification track.
* Other duties as assigned.

 **What you'll bring:**  

* CPQ knowledge required.
* Familiar with remote work environments and capable of working in a virtual office environment.
* Strong experience with at least one programming language (examples: javascript, C#, VB.NET).
* Must be comfortable speaking to customers both over the phone and in-in person
* General knowledge of

enterprise-level software systems like ERP & CRM.  

* Must be genuinely interested in solving complex process problems for manufacturing companies.
* Excellent

communication, both written and verbal, and presentation skills.  

* Analytical abilities and

problem-solving skills. **Qualifications:**

* BS/BA in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience taking complex customer and product concepts and developing solutions.

 **Extras:**  

* Experience automating CAD models with macros or any other CAD automation technology.
* Working with manufacturing companies

**The Professional Services Team**
Professional Services play an instrumental role in the growth of Epicor. You will be working with our customers to implement our products and ensure that we continuously provide an exceptional customer experience. Almost every position is customer-facing—therefore, it’s important to have energy, drive, and determination to ensure Epicor gives the best possible experience to all clients. This passion will contribute to the success of your career and the company. If you are looking for a global, innovative company with strong roots and exciting growth, Epicor is ready to hear from you!
**About Epicor**


At Epicor we know that success comes from working together. Everyone has a role to play, and it’s the essential partnerships across our company that are crucial to our customers’ success and our growth as a business.


We’re truly a team. Working in close partnership, we bring wide-ranging talents together in powerful collaborations. We think innovatively, share our knowledge generously, and constantly learn from our colleagues. We’re proud of the success we achieve every day, but we never stop challenging ourselves and encouraging each other. Together, we go further and imagine an even brighter future.


Whatever your career journey, we’ll help you find the right path. Through our training courses, mentorship, and continuous support, you’ll get everything you need to thrive. At Epicor, your success is our success. And that success really matters, because we’re the essential partners for the world’s most essential businesses—the hardworking companies who make, move, and sell the things the world needs.


**Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement**


Epicor is committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is valued; where you bring the whole and real you—that’s who we’re interested in. If you have interest in this or any role- but your experience doesn’t match every qualification of the job description, that’s okay- consider applying regardless.


We are an equal-opportunity employer.


Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location.

  

At Epicor, we care about your health and financial wellness, as well as your work-life balance. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefit offerings including medical coverages, dental, and vision, as well as other wellness programs. In addition, we offer a 401(k) match, HSA and FSA plans, a student debt program, a wide variety of insurance coverages, and voluntary benefits to achieve financial wellness. We also value your work-life balance and offer flexible time off, paid holidays, and paid maternity and parental leave. Please note that this is for information purposes only and provides a summary of Epicor's benefit offering.

title: Senior VDC Engineer, Mechanical & Piping
description:
This is a remote role in the United States. US work authorization is required.

 **About VIATechnik:**


VIATechnik is the global leader in Virtual Design and Construction. We have over 300 digital experts around the globe. The firm's services include Virtual Design & Construction (VDC), Building Information Modeling (BIM), Virtual & Augmented Reality, Digital Twins, and Enterprise Software Application Development.


We work on some of the industry's largest and most interesting projects such as Apple's new headquarters, Virgin Hyperloop One, Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) modernization & expansions, Denver International Airport, Chicago O'Hare International Airport, Hudson Yards, the Atlanta Falcons Stadium, Chase Arena, the Tesla Gigafactory and many more. Our team is made up of leading VDC professionals, technologists, architects, and engineers who have a passion for solving problems and a thirst for learning. We are results-driven, creative solution finders and enjoy putting ourselves in our clients' shoes.

 **The role:**


As a Senior VDC Engineer with a specialty in the mechanical and/or piping areas, you'll have the opportunity to apply your technical and engineering skills across a multitude of projects, and contribute to world-class thought leadership around BIM and VDC.


This includes ensuring that plumbing and/or mechanical projects for trade contractors incorporate BIM processes from schematic design through construction. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and has a deep passion for developing and implementing innovative BIM processes across dispersed teams.

 **In this role, you will:**

* Collaboratively and proactively lead the global project management of VDC/BIM projects, planning for and moving projects along independently
* Act as a specialist for our team in the plumbing and/or mechanical areas
* Serve as a primary interface to clients, cultivating client relationships. Regularly present work and conduct meetings with the client
* Respond to requests for information (RFIs) and manage the RFI submittal process
* Coordinate and lead global project teams to complete client work
* Create and manage complex commercial and industrial design projects within Revit, Navisworks, Procore, BIM360, and other supporting programs
* Contribute to our culture of professional development and knowledge sharing by participating in and leading training efforts
* Have the opportunity to get involved in projects where plumbing and/or mechanical isn't the focus, expanding your knowledge

 **Apply if you have:**

* A bachelor's or master's degree in Architecture, Engineering, or a similar discipline
* 3+ years of experience providing implementation, training, and support in BIM and VDC
* 3+ years of experience working for a plumbing and/or mechanical trade contractor
* Experience in combining and coordinating BIM updates, running clash detection on revised components and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders
* Experience modeling, drafting, producing drawings, and reading mechanical and plumbing plans
* Capability to work effectively in a self-directed way within an extremely fast-paced, ever-changing environment
* The ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects requiring frequent communication, organization, time management, and problem-solving skills
* Ability to read and interpret construction drawings, specifications, and contracts
* A proactive and flexible attitude; willingness to take an "all hands on deck" approach
* Ability to work some early/late hours to coordinate with project teams in other countries

 **Even better if you have:**

* Field construction experience
* Experience in leading online meetings and training sessions across remote project teams using platforms such as Asana
* Been involved in the administrative side of projects: invoicing, budgeting, scheduling, and forecasting
* Knowledge of other primary building systems - foundations, primary building structure and walls, electrical, fire protection, specialty systems, conveying systems and interior finishes and the sequence of assembly of each
* Experience managing BIM and VDC across a project lifecycle
* Understanding of real world constructability of modeled systems
* A portfolio of work you can share
* Proven track record of effectively working with and managing teams remotely
* Background in providing professional services to clients
* Experience with software such as AutoCAD MEP and/or Fabrication CADMEP

 **Compensation and featured benefits:**

* The pay for this position is **$84,000** to **$94,000**, and the role is eligible for bonuses. The actual salary offer may be higher as we carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and location
* Health insurance with the choice of several plan options. We cover 70-95% of premiums for VIATechies and 70% of the premiums for dependents
* Dental and vision insurance. We cover 75% of the monthly insurance premiums for VIATechies and 50% of the premiums for dependents
* Open and flexible time off
* A 401(k) plan that is fully vested immediately
* Home office setup costs
* Paid holidays

  

As a minority-owned and woman-led company, VIATechnik takes diversity and inclusion to heart. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.


VIATechnik is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) works with clients to make real estate a significant contributor to organizational productivity and performance. Our account management model is at the heart of our client-centric approach to delivering integrated real estate solutions. Each client is entrusted with a dedicated leader and is supported by regional and global resources, demonstrating the industry's most robust platform. CBRE GWS delivers consistent, measurably superior outcomes for our clients at every stage of the lifecycle, and across industries and geographies.


About the role


* As a new member of CBRE’s growing manufacturing engineering team, you will support our blue-chip technology giant through the facilitation and ownership of manufacturing readiness and ramp-up for multiple suppliers (“integrators”) to the client. To be successful, you will have extensive demonstrated success in optimizing manufacturing processes, launching new products through operations, implementing lean fundamentals in low-volume environments, and driving manufacturability improvements back into design. You will have the ability to quickly build influential relationships with key leaders and will have the ability to demonstrate the latter to ultimately achieve business results.

What you’ll do


Establish oneself as a shared resource to the client to drive manufacturing readiness for pilot and/or FOAK (First of a Kind) production runs

**Engage with PLM team in creation of NPI BOMs**
------------------------------------------------


Utilize organization PLM software associated with Design to route documents and attain proper approvals


Work with organization PLM software to create and update project requirements

**Organize and maintain BOM structures**
----------------------------------------


Analyze product drawings to ensure BOM accuracy and completeness


Be flexible in serving needs of the client as primary contact for the project team


Partner effectively, and with humility, as a team member, which contributes within the complete product development life cycle

  


What you’ll need


Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial Engineering or equivalent Manufacturing support discipline


Minimum 5 years in progressive roles related to manufacturing engineering, manufacturing scheduling, quality management, continuous improvement, project management, new product development, and/or operations management


Demonstrated understanding of product drawings to interpret manufacturing intent and specification requirements


Significant BOM and/or Data Management experience, getting results without direct authority

**Demonstrated ability to assess design engineering models and drawings**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Outstanding communicator who can express complex ideas in a concise manner


Proficiency with working with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets software


Working knowledge of construction quality and commissioning management (preferred)


Solid understanding of large scale HVAC, cooling, and/or electrical distribution systems (preferred)


Lean certification (preferred)


Why CBRE?


* A culture of respect, integrity, service and excellence crafts our approach to every opportunity!

title: Head of Project Management
description:
**Nikkiso Clean Energy & Industrial Gases** is a leading provider of cryogenic pumps, heat exchangers, process systems, services, and solutions for the LNG and industrial gases industry. We are a subsidiary of Nikkiso Company Ltd, a leading industrial manufacturer headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, with over $1.5B in annual revenue, 8000 + employees worldwide, and publicly traded on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.


**Location:** Leipzig, Germany.


**Summary/Objective:**


The Head of Project Management provides leadership to the project managers and supports on technical and commercial issues for the teams projects. The head of Project Management is reporting to Managing Director.


**Essential Functions/Responsibilities:**


* Leads the Project Managers & coordinate with Engineering group, act as the internal expert for project management / Provide direction and support to project management team.
* Plans, directs, supervises, and controls project operations.
* Manage the Project Management team and ensure successful execution of the projects, from pre-study to execution and delivery.
* Provide advice, support and guidance as needed to serve as mentor to colleagues.
* Provides leadership in the engineering functional group and mentors engineers in best practices.
* Assist with Project management capability.
* Plans and organizes contract and project management activities including cost re-estimates, manpower planning, work schedules, risk management, progress of certification and payment from customers/ consultant.
* Assemble and coordinate project staff, and develop full scale project plans.
* Manage project resource allocation.
* Implement and manage project changes and interventions to achieve project outputs.
* Ensure all resources are knowledgeable about process, services and procedures relative to the needs of the Project teams.
* Drive continuous improvement in the quality and effectiveness of the planning and project management / Project evaluations and assessment of results.
* Meet and support customers for kick off meetings, Pre-inspection meetings, progress reviews, inspections.
* Project take-over from applications/sales verifying the margins and all deliverable complete technical and commercial review completed and accepted by both parties.
* Evaluate and provide feedback regarding risks, quality, and overall probability of success to minimize negative impact on issue resolution objectives and deliverables.
* Collaborate / communicate with business leaders to translate strategic direction into a series of actionable, measurable projects / initiatives to achieve both short-term and long-term goals and objectives.
* Provide regular and timely communication to stakeholders through the use of status reports and roadmaps and managing, reporting.
* Contributing to the harmonization and automation of processes and tools to enable business growth by improving team productivity.
* Ensure compliance of project management with global processes and tools in pre-sales and delivery phases.
* Provision of management information to key stakeholders, especially Region and management.
* Agree on actions resulting from development of project pipeline, workforce planning together with HR.
* Maintain the planned Gross Margins and ensure / increase customer satisfaction.
* P&L accountability for all projects.


**Education, Experience & Competencies:**


* Technical background.
* Communication in English and German.
* Knowledge on contract, legal and financial negotiation.
* Strong negotiator with the ability to work successfully with a large, diverse and demanding set of clients.
* Experience working in a fast paced, deadline driven environment Comfort with ambiguity and dynamically shifting priorities, timelines, and demands.
* Expert knowledge of application development methodologies and technologies.
* Expert knowledge of business standards and professionalism, operations processes and methodologies.
* Standardization/rationalization in engineering design of products is required where possible to reduce configurations.
* Strong project manages and analysis skills and experience in leading teams.
* Minimum 10 years’ experience in providing Project Management.
* Minimum BS/BA degree with at least 10 years of experience and a track record in successful senior operational and project management.
* Excellence in organizational management with the ability to coach a project managers team to manage and develop high-performance teams and develop and implement program strategies.
* Deep experience in operations budgeting and fiscal management.
* Ability to lead in a dotted line / matrix organizational structure.
* Flexibility to manage several activities at one time.
* Ability to integrate teams to work in complex cross cultural environment.
* Excellent negotiation, decision making and problem solving skills.
* Software MS Project.
* Must be able to work effectively in a team environment and will interface closely with Quality, Project Management, Manufacturing, Purchasing, and Operations.
* Bring knowledge and creativity to the position as well as have the discipline to drive results and follow established fundamental processes.
* Demonstrated team building and leadership skills.
* Demonstrated ability to motivate and innovate.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors and other staff
* Skills required to support these duties include organization, critical and analytical thinking, leadership, and communication.
* Excellent planning skills for large scale industrial projects.
* Excellent people management and upliftment skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel/Word/MS Project) & PDF.
* Competent specially and in the packaging of plants and equipment.
* Competent in multi-disciplinary management, process, electrical, instrumentation, mechanical design, structural.
* A bachelor’s degree in engineering (mechanical or chemical) is required and +15 years of experience in a management role of an engineering company.
* Familiarity with ASME, API, ISO, and other international standards


**Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled**


Nikkiso CE&IG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Senior Principal Mechanical Engineer
description:
Overview:
**At ENERCON, we're leading America's Energy Transition and shaping the future.**

ENERCON serves several markets throughout the energy sector, including data centers, mission critical facilities, the federal government, industrial, nuclear power, power delivery, grid infrastructure, power generation, and renewable energy.


We invest in emerging technologies and foster a sense of innovation within our teams so that we may bring powerful solutions to our clients and add value to their businesses.
Driven by four key values, we seek to foster a positive, innovative culture that is carried into our projects.* **Employee Development.** We invest in the development of our people and value each person’s background, experience and ideas as drivers of our competitive advantage.
* **Create Client Value.** We believe in client partnership. Through sound engineering and environmental support, we support our clients in achieving their mission.
* **Excellence, every project.** We operate to the highest quality and safety standards to deliver value to our clients.
* **Continuous Improvement.** We are driven by innovation, integrity and excellence to continually move forward.


Responsibilities:

Due to continued growth, ENERCON’s Nuclear Services Group (NSG) is seeking a **Senior Principal** **Mechanical Engineer** to support engineering activities for our client’s nuclear power plants on a part-time basis. This position may require travel to the plants for short periods of time. This is a remote position.

 **Responsibilities (including but are not limited to):**

* Prepare error-free engineering documents (e.g., drawings, sketches, instructions, inputs, calculations, analyses, evaluations) according to and bounded by industry codes, standards, and regulations to support client engineering needs.
* Generate engineering related documents in accordance with client, ENERCON, and regulatory requirements, adhering to client and ENERCON procedures, processes, specifications, and other company or project directives.
* Maintain up to date and relevant knowledge of industry codes and standards, safety culture, and design techniques suitable to the nuclear industry.
* Provide peer and technical reviews of engineering designs and engineering related documentation produced by others.
* Produce high quality engineering deliverables in accordance with client and ENERCON Quality Assurance (QA) Programs that are consistent with project work scopes and client expectations.
* Provide technical guidance and oversee technical work performed by others to maintain quality standards. Review and check products prepared by other engineers.
* Apply technical principles, theories, standards, and concepts and make recommendations based on knowledge and experience.
* Work with a multidisciplinary team.
* Travel to the site, as needed to perform job duties.
* Support Failure Modes & Effects Analysis (FMEA), equipment/system testing, as needed.


Qualifications:
**Re****quired Qualifications / Skills:**

* B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or other related engineering degree and 10+ years of experience in the nuclear power industry
* Advanced knowledge of applicable industry and regulatory codes and standards pertaining to the nuclear power industry.
* Proficient in typical office software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, and Outlook.
* Good writing, presentation, and communication skills.
* Ability to be an individual contributor and work effectively in teams

**Employment Requirement**
Ability to pass pre-employment and random drug and alcohol screenings, ENERCON and client specific background checks, and annual motor vehicle record (MVR) according to company and client policies. **Must be legally eligible to work in the US without current or future sponsorship.**  

This job posting is subject to change at any time.  

Enercon Services, Inc (ENERCON) offers excellent benefits and career opportunities as part of our culture of excellence. Our people are the driving force behind our work. Together, we advance industries and drive innovation.  

ENERCON does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. #LI-SH7  

Connect with us: www.enercon.com | LinkedIn

title: Senior Aircraft Structural Design Engineer
description:
Due to Growth CIT Franklin is looking for aerospace and mechanical engineers experience with design and substantiation of aircraft structures. The openings we have are both entry level and experienced. Our mechanical engineers are responsible for the development and documentation of mechanical designs in a cross-functional engineering team environment. Provides support to other departments including manufacturing, sales, customer service, and quality.

Products include high-performance electro-mechanical systems and components, integrated structures, and control panels used for aircraft entertainment, navigation, and communication systems. The positions will be involved in Creates designs by analyzing product or equipment specifications, performance requirements, and existing manufacturing capabilities. Depending on role can perform basic to moderately complex design, fabrication, modification, and evaluation of products by applying engineering principals and established analytical tools. Develops detailed designs by using provided by others. Research manufacturing or processing techniques, materials, properties, process advantages, and limitations as part of long-range plant and product engineering planning. Candidates should be familiar with MS Office and 3D design software. Knowledge about the operation and design of aircraft Mechanical and avionics systems is a plus. Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or 4 years related industry experience.

We offer competitive compensation packages, including benefits such as health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off. Join our team of talented engineers and contribute to innovative projects in the field of Aerospace Engineering. Apply now to be part of our dynamic organization.
