title: Engineering Subject Matter Expert
description:
PDHengineer.com is looking for qualified engineers to present webinars and write courses for our online continuing education platform. THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION THAT CAN BE PERFORMED FROM YOUR OWN HOME OR OFFICE.

This is a part-time position as an independent contractor. There is no minimum time commitment.

**WEBINAR INSTRUCTOR**

Presenting webinars is a great way to develop a substantial side revenue stream without a large investment of time. Share your knowledge in a lively discussion-based format from the comfort of your own home or office.

The video component of the webinar is distributed over the internet using a PowerPoint presentation. Audio is delivered to webinar participants using either a phone line or their computer’s built-in audio. You simply make the live presentation just as if you were in front of the audience. The webinar attendees can ask questions and interact with you at all times.

We offer flexible scheduling of webinars to fit your calendar.

You are responsible for creating the PowerPoint slides for your presentation. You will be paid $125/hour for every hour of live instruction you provide during the webinars.

Additionally, if you wish, your presentations can be recorded and published on our website to serve as the content for self-study courses. You will be paid a royalty each time your self-study course is purchased by one of our customers. (See the description below for COURSE AUTHOR.)

**COURSE AUTHOR**

Write course(s) in Microsoft Word format (or record videos) at your own pace and email them to us. Then sit back and earn royalties while we do all the work. Our team will handle the formatting and publication of your courses. You earn a royalty payment on every sale generated by your courses.

These are self-study courses. You are not required to teach in front of a live audience. After submitting a course for publication on our website, your work is done.

After your course is published, it is available online for engineers to purchase and complete. You continue to earn royalties from your courses year after year – without having to do any additional work.

AS A COURSE AUTHOR, THERE IS NO GUARANTEED AMOUNT OF COMPENSATION. You will receive compensation only when your courses are purchased by our customers.

Although there’s no guaranteed amount of compensation, some of our most prolific course authors collect more than $50,000 in royalty payments every year without doing any additional work. Their recurring income is realized solely from courses they created years ago.

Skills/Experience:  
Must be highly knowledgeable and experienced on the topic of your course or webinar presentation.

Must have at least a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field from an accredited university and a minimum of 7 years’ experience practicing as an engineer post-graduation (Registered Professional Engineers are strongly preferred)

Duties and Schedule:

There are no employment benefits associated with this position.

There is no set work schedule associated with this position. As a course author, you can work at your own pace. As a webinar instructor, we’ll work with you to schedule your webinars on dates/times that are amenable to you.

Compensation for course authors will be royalty-based at an agreed-upon rate. Income will vary depending on course popularity and the volume of courses published.

Compensation for presenting a webinar will be $125/hour for every hour of live instruction you provide during the webinars.

Course Topics:  
Webinar instructors and course authors with knowledge and experience in all the following areas are needed:  
Renewable Energy  
Engineering Ethics  
Civil Engineering  
Mechanical Engineering  
Concrete  
Electrical Engineering  
Structural Engineering  
Geotechnical Engineering  
Stormwater  
Piping and Valve Design and Selection  
Energy Conservation  
Forensic Engineering and Failure Appraisement  
Fire Protection  
Building Systems Design (HVAC, Electrical, Plumbing)  
Sustainable Design  
LEED topics  
Green Engineering

Retired engineers are welcome.

About PDHengineer.com / Decatur Professional Development:

Founded in 2003, Decatur Professional Development has helped tens of thousands of professional engineers fulfill their state-mandated continuing education requirements through online courses, correspondence courses, webinars and seminars. Decatur Professional Development’s continuing education products are available on the website PDHengineer.com.

You can find more information here: https://www.pdhengineer.com/write-course/.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $125.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Engineering: 4 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Professional Engineering License (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
As the Field Services Engineer, you will be responsible for delivering the desired customer service experience. The goal is to drive service success that improves customer satisfaction, maximizes customer retention and increases profitability.



Sartorius is seeking a Field Service Engineer to join the team serving the greater Boston area!


This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to join a driven and growing team self-starters, proactive, and energetic candidates who are looking to contribute with ideas, innovative thinking, and tireless actions should apply. We offer an outstanding work-life balance yet an intense, challenging, and fast-paced working environment. Your work will have a real-world impact and support you in achieving your career goals.

**The ideal candidate must reside in the Boston area or be willing to relocate to Boston.**


Sartorius is seeking a Field Service Engineer to join the team serving the greater Boston area! This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to join a driven and growing team self-starters, proactive, and energetic candidates who are looking to contribute with ideas, innovative thinking, and tireless actions should apply. We offer an outstanding work-life balance yet an intense, challenging, and fast-paced working environment. Your work will have a real-world impact and support you in achieving your career goals.

**What you will accomplish together with us:**

* You will provide exceptional customer care and build positive relationships with customers
* In the event of an issue, you will provide technical support to customers
* One of your responsibilities will be to tie workflow to schedule to minimize unnecessary travel and travel to customers by ground, train, and air transportation as needed
* You will provide training to customers on the essential use and operation of Bio Analytics instruments
* You will perform field service, calibration, and installation of complex mechanical systems and perform preventative maintenance and field sterilizations
* One of your tasks will be to assist with resolving IT issues related to Bio Analytics system installations. Follow all company's procedures and protocols, as well as, perform software updates/upgrades
* You will assist in drafting documentation of process and procedure as required
* Keep accurate records via written and paper form, keep an accurate count of parts assigned to the engineer
* On a regular basis, you will be asked to produce timely, accurate, and detailed service reports and prepare customer-facing estimates of repairs
* Pass along identified leads to the sales manager
* Travel to our Ann Arbor, MI, Albuquerque, NM, Fremont, CA, and additional facilities and sites for training and conferences as needed
* All other duties as assigned by management

**What will convince us:**

* You have completed an Associate's Degree or certifications in engineering or military training and 5+ years of proven field service experience.
* Completion of Bachelor's Degree in mechanical engineering, biomechanical engineering, biomedical engineering, or a related field Preferred
* You have a minimum of 3+ years of field service experience in the Bio-Pharmaceutical industry
* You have a valid Drivers License and Passport
* You are proficient with MS Office software, including Outlook, Word and Excel.

**We Value:**

* You are able to troubleshoot, test, repair, and service technical equipment with excellent mechanical, electrical, and IT skills
* You have the ability to work flexible shifts and adapt to changing work schedules
* Expect up to 25% overnight travel to support Field Service activities
* Lift items that weigh up to 35 Kg
* Familiarity with mobile tools and applications
* Excellent driving record
* Identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment

**What We Offer**


As a growing global life science company, with our stock listed on the German DAX and TecDAX , Sartorius offers a wide range of benefits:  

**Personal and Professional Development:** Mentoring, leadership programs, LinkedIn Learning, internal seminar offerings  

**Worklife Balance:** Paid vacation, sick time, corporate holidays and community service day; as well as flexible work schedules  

**Making an Impact Right from the Start:** Comprehensive onboarding, including a virtual online platform  

**Welcoming Culture:** Mutual support, team spirit and international collaboration; communities on numerous topics such as “Coaching”, “Agile Working” and a “Businesswomen’s Network”  

**Health & Well Being:** Wide selection of health and well-being support such as a variety of medical plans to choose from, dental, vision, EAP, and other wellness programs.  

**Intelligent Working Environment:** Working in smart buildings with the latest technology and equipment.

**Retirement Savings Plan:** 401 k (with generous company match)  

**Flexible Spending:** HSA, FSA (dependent care & healthcare spending), Transportation Commuter Account  

**Company Paid Benefits:** Basic Life Insurance, AD&D, EAP, Family Planning & Women’s Health, Health Advocate  

**Additional/Optional:** Supplemental Life Insurance (employee, spouse & dependents), Legal Services, LTD & STD, Critical Illness Insurance, Student Loan Tuition Refinance Service


All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.


Please view equal employment opportunity posters provided by OFCCP here.

title: Mechanical Engineer (MEP) Designer
description:
**Overview:** Experienced Mechanical Engineer MEP Designer using Revit and AutoCAD in the design of MEP systems for commercial building projects under the supervision of a Professional Engineer while working remotely.

**Location/Type:** Athens, GA (1.5Hr max commute) Fully remote/Full-time

**Job Description:** An individual with at minimum of 4 years of experience capable of designing the following systems under the supervision of a PE:

* HVAC
* Electrical
* Plumbing
* Energy optimization

Required tasks:

* The design of MEP building systems using Revit and AutoCAD
* Preparation of schedules, construction documents, and complete plan sets,
* Performing load calculations
* Code verification and compliance research
* Sizing and selecting of equipment as well as laying out and sizing of piping and ductwork
* Helping to train individuals in the engineering department with less experience
* Visiting project sites for surveys, punch lists and more
* Client meetings and communications
* Required trainings for professional growth

Project types:

* Commercial: including Office spaces, Restaurants, Retail, Hospitality, Educational, Ecclesiastical, and more
* Manufacturing
* Multi-family and large scale residential

The above tasks will be preformed largely from a home office as this position is remote to provide a better work-life balance for the select individual. In office meetings with clients, in office trainings, and project site visits will be necessary occasionally. As we value “multi-disciplinary growth”, this role will provide opportunities to get involved in a broad spectrum of designs and trainings. Our firm values a collaborative approach and each team member’s input as well as their personal growth in the field and within the firm.

**Remote Work Description:** As this position is fully remote the selected individual will be expected to perform the duties of designing and drafting using Revit and AutoCAD from a home office located within a maximum of 1.5Hr drive from Athens, Ga. Daily scheduled meetings will be held remotely via platforms such as “Microsoft Teams” where plans will be discussed, screen sharing and on camera video calls (with no altered backgrounds) will be expected both with the team and with clients. An individual will be available via email, text, phone call or “Teams” during working hours of 8am to 6pm. Our office will serve, as it does for all our employees, as a “check in, check out” hub as well as a space for trainings, collaborative teamwork, and client meetings.

**What We’re Looking For:** An excellent communicator who talented, honest, proactive, a good listener and with a passion for building systems design and growth within the A/E field. Organization, attention to details, as well as critical thinking and speed are important. Personal time management is a HIGHLY valued skill as individuals must be able to complete work by the given deadlines. As this is an out of office position, self-discipline and self-motivation are key.

**About our Firm:** ensembleD Architecture and Engineering saw it’s opening in 2021 and is based in Athens, Georgia. To create a better work-life balance in the time-consuming field of A/E, we are a fully remote team providing flexibility to our team while still meeting the client’s deadline. Our goal is to serve each client with honesty, professionalism and punctuality and provide them with effective, cohesive, and inspiring design solutions. Our approach stems from a multi-disciplinary design base. We hold to the belief that any project’s success is the result of a collaborative process between all team members. We value humility and a servant mentality of “how can I help”, from the most mundane to the more advanced tasks our field has to offer. We strive to work in “unity with clients, in design and within community”.

For more information about our firm, please visit our website at www.ensembledae.com.

**Qualification:**

- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering field required

- 4 or more years of experience is required

- AutoCAD proficient

- Revit experience is a plus

- Mechanical & Plumbing drafting and design experience

- Electrical drafting and design

- EIT is required

- Remote work experience is a plus

- Driver’s license required

- US work authorization required

- Example files demonstrating expertise in the field is a plus.

**Benefits:**

- Remote work

- Friendly and Flexible working environment

- All equipment and software provided

- Training opportunities

- PTOs and paid holidays

- Paid sick leave, Parental leave

- Healthcare compensation, Dental & Vision Insurance

- 401K plus match

- Salary based on experience

- And more.

title: Fuels Associate Engineer I - (Hybrid/Remote)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION  

DESCRIPTION**

The Civil and Environmental Practice seeks an enthusiastic and motivated Mechanical Engineer to join our growing and high performing Fuel System and Environmental Compliance team based in Virginia Beach, VA. Responsibilities will include planning, executing, and documenting environmental compliance projects related to the storage and distribution of petroleum, oils, and lubricant (POL) facilities and infrastructure for a well-established client. This includes inventories, inspections and management plans for Petroleum Storage Tanks (PSTs) and related spill response and prevention activities and plans such as development of Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures (SPCC) plans.


You will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, collaborative engineering team, with staff located in the Virginia Beach office and in other Michael Baker offices located across the United States (US). In addition, you will have the opportunity to travel across the US (including Alaska, Hawaii and territories) as well as internationally (including Europe, Asia and Africa) to various Department of Defense installations.


The successful candidate will be a motivated self-starter who displays a passion for solving complex problems for our clients, interacting in a team environment, and meeting established project requirements. Michael Baker is committed to the growth of our internal personnel and we support this with world class learning and development. Within the Fuel System and Environmental Compliance Team, the candidate will be mentored by seasoned project managers and have opportunities for career advancement. In addition, the successful candidate will have the personal satisfaction of completing activities to protect the environment we live in for our clients while protecting our military mission.


This position is based in Virginia Beach, VA. Applicants desiring to work remotely or from other Baker office locations may be considered dependent on qualifications.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

Under direct supervision, assists and supports a Project Team of engineers in planning, executing, and documenting environmental engineering projects. Essential duties:


* Evaluates and develops technical scopes of work and cost estimates for unique project requirements.
* Evaluates the applicability of state and federal environmental regulations.
* Prepares documents for regulatory agencies to obtain required permits.
* Communicates with Project Team on technical and administrative requirements.
* Attends internal meetings as necessary and documents key decisions and action items.
* Prepares for site visits by evaluating project scopes of work and coordinating site work activities with onsite personnel and vendors.
* As directed, completes site visits by traveling to sites to meet with clients and initiate, oversee, document, and troubleshoot the execution of environmental compliance work.
* Following site visits evaluates vendor reports of site work and prepare technical reports documenting the project scopes of work.
* Completes project technical requirements within established budgets and schedules.
* As directed, performs quality assurance activities.
* Completes continuing education and training to maintain professional expertise and credentials.

**PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Bachelor of Science in Mechanical/ Civil Engineering or equivalent.
* 0 - 4 years of engineering experience.
* Engineer Intern/Engineer-in-Training certification preferred.
* Experience in Department of Defense civil and environmental engineering and/or environmental compliance projects is preferred.
* Experience with tank and piping inspections, spill response planning and development of SPCC Plans is a plus.
* Certification in tank and/or piping inspection (such as STI SP001/API 653/API 570) is also a plus.
* Excellent technical writing and communications skills. Excellent skills in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat. Proficient skills in AutoCAD will also be considered.
* Site visits mayrequire the ability to traverse uneven terrain wearing PPE(Personal Protection Equipment) and carrying light equipment necessary for data collection andreporting.
* Travel is required for this position and the individual must be legally authorized to work in the U.S., with a valid U.S. passport and eligible for security clearance. Travel requirements for this position are between 25-50% of the work schedule and include domestic and international destinations.

**COMPENSATION**

The approximate compensation range for this position is $64,000-$93,000 . This compensation range is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Actual compensation is dependent upon factors such as education, qualifications, experience, skillset, and physical work location.


  
ABOUT US  

Michael Baker International, a leading provider of engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, architectural, environmental, construction and program management, has been solving some of the world’s most complex infrastructure challenges for more than 80 years with a legacy of expertise, experience, innovation and integrity.
  

  

Based in Pittsburgh and with nearly 100 offices nationwide, we partner with clients on everything from roads, bridges, tunnels, mass transit, and airports, to water treatment plants, arctic oil pipelines, environmental restoration and specialized overseas construction. We serve as a trusted adviser to the communities we serve, making them safer, more accessible, more sustainable and more prosperous.
  

  

We provide visionary leadership in facilitating transformational change for our clients. Our work delivers differentiating innovations and dedicated experts who challenge the status quo and share a world of diverse experience and an impassioned entrepreneurial spirit. We deliver quality of life.
  

  

We Make a Difference.
  

  

Michael Baker International is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Michael Baker International provides equal employment opportunity for all persons, in all facets of employment. Michael Baker International maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified and all will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status.
  

  

EEO is the Law. Applicants to and employees of Michael Baker International are protected under Federal law from discrimination.

title: Packaging Engineer
description:
Job Title: Packaging Engineer


Location: Remote, Chicago, IL/Midwest or Central, PA preferred


Travel: Up to 75%

  


**Summary:**


With minimal supervision from the Manager, the position leads the design and technical development of packaging solutions for new and existing products. This position is responsible for the development of packaging materials by working with Project Teams and Vendors to recommend, review, test and identify costs for various packaging design proposals. The position is responsible for creating detailed specifications and accurate bill of materials for successful packaging implementation. The position supports production facilities by assisting in issues resolution and optimizing packaging design to ensure peak performance.


The position is expected to manage a mix of low-to-medium complexity commercial projects which require fundamental packaging technology expertise. As a representative on project teams, the position is expected to advocate the best interests of packaging via sharing of technical knowledge, gathering fact-based data, providing analytics, and implementing solutions which deliver against project scope and expectations.

  


**Major Duties & Key Responsibilities:**


**Product & Packaging Development/Commercialization**


* Collaborate with project initiator to define, understand, and align to project objectives and expectations.
* Design, review, recommend, and test various packaging design proposals.
* Consider various packaging material substrates and structures in the design of primary, secondary and tertiary packaging to minimize material usage and optimize manufacturing and labor efficiencies, while maintaining product integrity and enhancing retail performance and aesthetics.
* Determine impact of new packaging design on existing and new automation systems at manufacturing locations.
* Develop design-of-experiments/test methodologies on packaging materials and structures to determine performance attributes best suited to maintain product quality, integrity, and maximize shelf-life while minimizing costs.
* Conduct analytical testing on materials and structures; evaluate and interpret technical data findings and clearly communicate results to stakeholders.
* Coordinate and support equipment trials, line trials, distribution tests, etc. to validate new packaging materials and structural designs
* Recommend best design, align with stakeholders, and execute optimized packaging design solution.
* Contribute to project success through clear written and verbal correspondence and presentations understandable by stakeholders of varying technical & business understanding
* Ensure projects remain on schedule by setting achievable expectations, proactively driving tasks for on-time completion, proactively highlighting potential risks to task completion, timely responses to communications, and actively participating in project team meetings.
* Simultaneously manage multiple projects and prioritize work accordingly to meet established and aligned to timelines and deliverables for each.
* Assess and resolve identified packaging design problems and opportunities (ie. consumer, retail, distribution, manufacturing performance) on existing items. Work with cross-functional stakeholders to implement design, quality, process, and system improvements as a result of findings to ensure long-term corrective action.

  




**Documentation**


* Create and publish robust and accurate specifications which detail critical attributes to ensure consistent material quality and packaging assembly to meet aligned performance requirements. This includes mechanical drawings, written specifications, and process instructions.
* Provide necessary packaging component mechanical drawings for artwork development and layout. Approve graphical artwork for correct application to mechanical drawing and critical-to-function attributes (ie. UPC, date code, eyetrack)
* Create, enter and publish accurate packaging bill of materials into the Material Data Management System to enable planning and sourcing of materials, and correct build of the Finished Good Item.
* Publish specifications and bill of materials to meet established timelines and priorities to enable production planning and material order requirements.
* Support creation and review of packaging quality standards and tolerances, and regulator documents.
* Work with Procurement to obtain cost estimates for new packaging materials by providing necessary specifications and information. Assist in presenting cost estimates for input into business case impact analytics.
* Ensure packaging related risks and key decisions are proactively, timely, visibly, clearly, and thoroughly documented in project team minutes, gate review documentation, on-line project folder/archives, project presentations, and emails.
* Ensure technical reports documenting test results, data, and analytics are appropriately archived in shared data sites/folders, project folder/archives, etc. for easy identification and retrieval.

  




**Packaging Optimization**


* Identify and initiate packaging research aimed at decreasing costs, reducing material usage, and improving recyclability while maintaining product & packaging integrity.
* Partner with Procurement on implementation of cost reduction strategies/initiatives.
* Conduct value analysis activities to identify and implement packaging material and structural changes to improve production and labor efficiencies.
* Review internal and external customer data to understand causation of packaging failure or sub-optimal performance, and develop/implement corrective actions accordingly.
* Identify and drive opportunities to standardize materials to reduce complexity and enable volume leveraged pricing for packaging components

  




**Continuous Self-Development and Improvement**


* Develop and maintain a professional knowledge of new and emerging trends in packaging technology.
* Identify areas of opportunity to implement new technologies into packaging solutions.
* Identify individual Global Behavior and ‘Ways of Working’ gaps, develop action plan to close gaps, and actively work to close gaps and strengthen skillsets/behaviors

  


**Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:**


* Possess basic understanding of packaging concepts and principles.
* Fundamental technical knowledge of packaging materials and converting technologies
* Possess mechanical aptitude and ability to understand interrelation of material & equipment
* Ability to design transport simulation tests and interpret results.
* Good critical thinking skills to consider how constraints/changes impact design and functional attributes
* Demonstrated successful problem solving process skills
* Ability to make rational decisions independently and seek assistance as needed for complex matters
* Ability to successfully communicate complex subject matter both verbally and in written form to audiences of varying organizational levels and technical/business understanding with some manager guidance.
* Basic understanding of supply chain operations and cross-functional partner responsibilities
* Able to work collaboratively with others to accomplish a common objective.
* Self-motivated and takes initiative/action with minimal direction
* Ability to successfully and consistently prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Good organizational, time management, and communication skills to meet commitments.
* Strong PC skills; Outlook, Excel, Powerpoint, Cape/Tops, MS Teams, SAP(nice to have)

  




**Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:**


BS in Packaging Engineering preferred with 1-3 years of Packaging Development experience.


BS in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or related science field with 1-3 years of experience in Packaging Development.

title: Mechanical Structural Design Engineer
description:
Develops, integrates and documents structural and interior payload system requirements to establish the system design. Develops, maintains and modifies structural and interior payload system and component designs, using 3-D Computer Aided Design tools and/or other design methods, to provide product definition to other engineering groups, production operations, suppliers and external customers throughout the product lifecycle. Performs, integrates analytical and test results to validate and verify systems and components meet requirements and specifications. Manages supplier development, test and production activities and coordinates with the supplier to optimize the design and achieve program goals. Develops new design/analysis processes and tools to improve the effectiveness, quality and efficiency of the development effort. Investigates emerging technologies to develop concepts for future product designs to meet projected requirements. Works under general direction.

Level 3 Must Haves:  
-Catia experience  
-Experience with layouts, drawings  
-Experience with structures with airlines, commercial structures  
- MUST have one of the following degrees: BS/MS Mechanical, Aerospace or Civil  
- Level 3: 8 years of experience

Design engineers  
- Boeing Commercial Airplane Structures Fuselage/Wing experience and layout experience  
- Design integration experience working with suppliers and global partners

Job Type: Temporary

Salary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Maritime Hull, Mechanical & Engineering (HME) Advisor
description:
Sayres, a leading provider of defense support services to the DOD, is currently seeking an experienced **Maritime Hull, Mechanical & Engineering (HME) Advisor** with SECRET clearance, verifiable in DISS.


As a key member of our team, you'll leverage your expertise in hull, mechanical, and engineering systems to ensure efficient operations and maintenance procedures to support the PMS 300/325 contract. This position can be supported remotely or based in Washington, DC and will have ongoing travel TDY to Panama. Travel requirements may be discussed upon interview.


**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
* 5+ years of equivalent experience in hull, mechanical, and engineering systems.
* Or 10+ years of experience with maritime engineering / maintenance procedures, maintenance management, and supply at the Unit- or Intermediate-level
* Required, including training in Maintenance Management Course, Maintenance Leaders Course, Joint Logistics Course, Logistics Readiness Officer, Logistics and Life Cycle Management, Supply Chain Management, and as a Port Engineer Officer or equivalent courses.
* 5+ years of experience with working in a maintenance organization, including supervising individuals performing maintenance tasks or conducting maintenance training.
* 5+ years of experience with management in an organization supporting military maritime maintenance and logistics operations.
* Experience in troubleshooting OEM maintenance software adoption/utilization, data collection & reporting, and resource management / sustainment for routine, periodic, and corrective maintenance actions.
* 2+ years of experience working in Latin America.
* Fluency in Spanish in professional and technical environments, including speaking, writing, reading, and listening at a level equivalent to a Foreign Service Institute 3/3 or DLPT 2+/2+/2+.
* Secret clearance verifiable in DISS.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 0-4 in the U.S. Coast Guard or U.S. Navy
* Two (2) years of experience in establishing and institutionalizing service level maritime maintenance and logistics programs and processes inclusive of the management structure, procedures, and skills necessary to develop maintenance plans and logistics requirements,


Clearance: Secret clearance


The position description is only meant to be a representative summary of the major responsibilities and accountabilities performed by the incumbents of this position. The incumbents may be requested to perform position-related tasks other than those stated in this description. **All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.**


At Sayres, our employees enjoy an atmosphere conducive to realizing their potential through personal and professional development while simultaneously exceeding customers' expectations.

title: HVAC Engineer-Mechanical
description:
**HVAC Engineer**
Irvine, CA
Full-time
**What We are Looking For**
The ideal candidate for this position is familiar with the HVAC (Heating/Cooling) industry with strong experience in related product standards and laboratory test environment. testing. The candidate must be well organized and able to maintain a full list of technical documentation from test reports and related product literature. They must have good communication and teamwork skills with an aptitude for attention to detail. In addition, the candidate must be highly self-motivated, have a positive attitude and be resourceful.
**Responsibilities**
* Obtain and maintain product certifications through various nationally recognized testing agencies.
* Submit required information/reports to regulatory agencies or local jurisdictions as needed.
* Complete submittals for new product efficiency testing in compliance with federal and certification agency requirements.
* Assist in creating/updating technical documents such as manuals, specification sheets, etc.
* Work with Product Managers in updating and distributing new technical information to internal and external team members.
* Provide HVAC engineering support to sales representatives, installers, contractors, distributors, engineers and architects to ensure product installation compliance to company/code standards.

**Requirements**
* Engineering degree from an accredited college/university.
* 3-5 years’ experience in an HVAC-related field with certification and lab testing experience preferred.
* Ability to articulate product information concisely to all levels of customers and internal personnel: end-user, contractor, sales/product managers, distributor, engineers and architects.
* Effective time management and organizational skills.
* Able to manage productivity goals and quality standards.
* Excellent attention to detail.
* Occasional off-site visits for product testing (R&D or certification).
* Familiar with Microsoft Office suite.

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Hands-on experience in a lab testing environment preferred
* Experience with ANSI/CSA product safety standards
	+ EnergyStar/AHRI/DOE/ASHRAE Energy Efficiency standards
* Knowledge of Navien products or the Heating/Cooling industries.

**Pay Scale****:** $83k-$92k annually (depending on experience) + eligible for annual bonus
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities, activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.
**Benefits**
* PPO Medical, Dental, Ortho, Vision, Rx, LTD and Life Insurance
* Employee-only premium covered at 100%, and dependent premium covered at 50%
* Optional Voluntary Benefits: STD, Hospital, Critical Illness, Accident, Discounted Pet Insurance
* Pre-Tax Flex Spending Accounts: Health and/or Dependent Care
* 10.5 Paid Holidays per calendar year
* Community Involvement Volunteer Day
* 401K Plan, 100% match on employee’s contribution, up to a maximum of 5%
* Employee discounts on Navien products
* LinkedIn Learning License

Life Style Spending Account: You choose* - gas, pet care, elder care, gym membership
* Work from Home Benefit
**About Navien, Inc.**
Since 2006, Navien, Inc. has become one of the fastest growing companies in the home comfort sector in North America and is now the leader in condensing technology, providing condensing tankless water heaters, combi-boilers, wall-hung boilers, and advanced water treatment solutions. Navien's products possess state-of-the-art technology, high efficiency, and reliable quality.  

  

Navien has achieved international recognition for its sophisticated engineering and robust designs. Backed by parent company, KD Navien, with more than forty years of experience with advanced boiler and water heating technology, Navien will continue its mission to provide high quality products. Navien products are available in the United States and Canada through a selected network of wholesale distributors.

**Navien, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: SCADA Project Engineer
description:
**What We Do**
==============


At Terabase Energy, we believe that *digitalization* and *automation* will drive the next wave of *innovation* and *cost reduction* in large scale solar. To fully unlock the potential of this opportunity, Terabase is developing an interconnected software and construction automation platform. We work alongside project developers, owners, and engineering & construction firms to support the design, optimization, and construction of huge solar projects around the world. Our team is a blend of solar-industry veterans and newbies, thought-leaders, dreamers, software, electrical and mechanical engineers, coders, product managers, project managers, and sales and marketing professionals. We are based in Northern California, with several other offices in the United States and around the world. If all of this piques your interest, we’d love to hear from you!

**The Role:**
=============

The Operational Technology Division is responsible for the engineering design and execution activities for SCADA, network, and controls on utility scale PV and Battery Storage power plants. This role join a team responsible for delivery of four major systems that this team is responsible for delivering: Plant Controls, SCADA, Field Instrumentation, and IT systems.


The Project Engineer will be the technical lead for a team in identifying customer requirements, analyzing, evaluating multiple solutions, developing functional and physical architecture, verifying, and validating high complexity systems. This position will assign tasks to junior engineers and technicians to achieve the designs. IN this position you will work the project from kickoff to customer hand over and will be supported by the design, development, and commissioning teams.

**Key Responsibilities:**
=========================

* Lead and/or self-perform the execution of engineering activities.
* Work with Engineering Manager and Project Managers to manage internal and external capacity to meet project milestones. Requests and evaluates engineering services proposals.
* Perform quality review of work performed by assigned staff; identify, investigate, and resolve internal and external quality issues on projects.
* Manage and control the generation, issuance, resolution, and close-out of requests for information, technical enquiry forms, and transmittals/submittals.
* Participate in preparation of proposals and scope development, including, conceptual designs and execution plans, engineering/project cost estimates and schedules.
* Coordinate technical activities and designs with personnel in other disciplines and departments within the local office.
* Provide leadership, training and mentoring to less experienced engineers and team members.
* Provide short term field support during construction.
* Any other actions required by management.

**Requirements:**
=================

* Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or other technical degree.
* Three years minimum of engineering experience performing development of solar projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency with AutoCAD.
* Project management experience is a plus.

**What We Offer**
=================

* Generous time off and holiday policy
* Remote flexibility
* Flexible time off
* Comprehensive benefits package
* Career progression
* 401k match
* Stock options
* Home office set up allowance
* And much more!

title: Application Engineer, Vacuum
description:
Description:
**What We Offer****:**

**Vooner, a member of the Aerzen Group**, offers a **competitive salary; generous health benefits** (to include **96% company-paid benefit plans)** with **company HSA contribution;** a **401(k) with company match;** and a **tuition reimbursement** program**;** along with the opportunity to work with a dynamic group of professionals in a **triple-bottom-line business philosophy of** ***“People, Planet, Prosperity”*****.**

**What You Will Do:**


As the Application Engineer, Vacuum, you will provide support to our sales representatives, production team, suppliers and customers by providing in-depth response to commercial and technical inquiries, preparing quotations and technical proposals, and providing application and product training as it relates to Vooner’s vacuum pump product offering. While this role can be done remotely, the successful candidate **must be able to travel to the plant in Greenville, TN**, to personally work with all departments. As well, there will be travel to key customer sites / distribution centers / meet with OEMs. Overall, **travel will be approximately 20%.** Additionally, you will:

  

* Lead specification and plan development for packaged systems. Ensure that Vooner products and accessories are fully integrated and special features capitalized upon in the specification.
* Effectively run customer projects from a remote location via Teams or Zoom. Must be able to clearly capture customer needs and establish a clean, detailed specification, then close the quote with the assistance of the sales team.
* Assist sales and sales representatives with application and product training as required. Prepare sales forecasts and other management reports as needed.
* Be a source of knowledge regarding industry news, trends, products, services, competitors, technologies, and new developments. Develop case studies that highlight Vooner products advantages.

**Who We Are****:**

**Vooner, a member of the Aerzen Group,** has over 31 years of experience with corrosion and erosion-resistant vacuum pump applications, including patented vacuum pump designs and vacuum system engineering capabilities. Additionally, Vooner is an OEM for complete vacuum systems for slurry dewatering, evaporation, pneumatic conveying, condenser exhauster, and felt cleaning in paper mills generating aftermarket business of actuators and sales opportunities for long term low-cost vacuum pumps.

**For more information visit our website at:** **www.vooner.com** Requirements:
**Education:** Bachelor’s Degree (four-year college or technical school); Field of Study - Mechanical Engineering or Science is preferred. Thermal Engineering Major or Concentration of study *HIGHLY DESIRED*

**Experience:** 8-10 years of vacuum pump application engineering experience. Preferably single-stage and two-stage liquid ring designs. Solid understanding of Wet VS Dry Vacuum Pumps and their related applications. Solid knowledge in Paper, Food, Plastics and Chemical industry is a plus.

**Computer Skills:** Able to create, use, navigate and generate reports at an Intermediate level of proficiency with Microsoft office applications. Able to navigate effectively ERP systems such as SAP, Sage, Navision. Knowledge of CRM systems such as Salesforce is a plus.

title: Mechanical Project Engineer
description:
Overview:

Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.  

We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment. **We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members.** ***"Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”*** **Our benefits include:**  

* Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one!
* Virtual Medical Services
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one)
* Paid parental leave
* Company paid life insurance
* Vacation time to enjoy getting away
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Plus, more!


Growth opportunities available! **Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!** **Summary of Position:**  

As a Mechanical Project Engineer, you will provide mechanical engineering support for maintenance and capital projects within the Knauf Insulation, North America footprint. Provide guidance to the staff engineer(s) and designer(s) at the Corporate level and the plant level in ongoing improvement of their portion of the fiberglass manufacturing process. Successfully complete major capital projects as assigned by management by demonstrating good project management skills.
Responsibilities:
* Ability to design and/or redesign mechanical equipment specifically in the areas of insulation manufacturing.
* Provides technical advice to other departments as needed
* Effectively manage Contractors and other Engineers for design, installation, and startup of equipment
* Develops improved processes in the fiberglass manufacturing process to improve quality, reduce scrap, improve utilization of raw materials, etc.
* Assists in start-up and de-bugging of new production facilities
* Aggressively pursues new technologies or equipment that can offer a benefit to the company
* Provides training for operators when new or improved processes are developed
* Offers troubleshooting assistance on processes or equipment when requested by the plants
* Assists in developing the Capital Spending Plan for each year for upcoming major projects.
* Ensures that drawings developed within the group are entered into the Knauf drawing system and that appropriate updates are made to drawings and equipment documentation as needed
* Develops/publishes standards and specifications for all equipment relating to the manufacture of fiberglass products
* Educates other engineers on common engineering practices used in the manufacture of fiberglass insulation


Qualifications:
**Education/Experience**:
* Bachelor's Degree in Engineering; and
* Five (5) years of experience in an industrial manufacturing environment

  

-or-  

* Ten (10) years of experience in industrial plant design and/or engineering; and
* Background in project management

 **Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:*** Ability to travel approximately 30% of the time
* Computer skills in MS Windows environment; proficient in Word, PowerPoint and Excel
* Knowledge of design techniques, tools and principals involved in production of technical plans, blueprints, drawings and models
* Knowledge of insulation manufacturing processes preferred

  

It is the policy of Knauf Insulation to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic prohibited by applicable law.

title: Applications Engineer– Indexable Tools
description:
**Title:** Applications Engineer – Indexable Tools


**Normal Work Location:** Munroe Falls OH or Remote preferably Chicago IL / Charlotte NC


**Normal Working Hours:** 8:00am – 5:00pm / Monday – Friday / Full Time

  



Kyocera Precision Tools is a leading manufacturer of indexable End Mills, Face Mills, Drills, Grooving, and Turning tools used around the world in diverse markets such as the automotive, medical, oil, and aerospace industries. We offer many opportunities for associates to use their existing talents and develop new ones. We are committed to the professional and personal enrichment of each associate. From skills development and training programs to Tuition Reimbursement, and our Learning Management System to support and enhance our associates’ skills at all levels of the organization. **Come join our Team!!!!**

  


**Position Summary**



This position is responsible for technical support for indexable tools. Position responsible for applying and recommending products at the end-users and machine builders and dealers. Position responsible for conducting various types of technical seminars and trainings to keep field sales and manufacturer representatives updated with the latest technologies. This position supports a lean and safe working environment while focusing on continuous improvement, quality, and support of teamwork throughout the Company.

  


**Essential Job Functions**


* Manage outside and inside technical support and application engineering groups.
* Fifty to seventy percent of travel is required to meet customer needs and influence customers by determining the best products and application of products.
* Report test results, case study information and document cost savings achievements.
* Provide training to field sales engineers and distributors on tool applications, benefits, features and use with support from manufacturer’s representatives.
* Provide solutions on tool applications via technical expertise.
* Respond to technical related inquiries through by phone, mail, chat, and web inquiry utilizing technical expertise.
* Manning the counter of special tool design cooperating with Kyocera Corporate and Wapakoneta designers.
* Provide tooling, time study and support turn-key business services for machine tool builders, machine tool dealers and end-users.
* Organizing field test activities of developing products for product planning including new product release and product phase out cooperating with Kyocera Corporate and indexable tool production.
* Report on monthly basis all field activities including business development, ongoing testing opportunities, results of completed testing opportunities, end user training and other pertinent information regarding responsible teams.
* Report market trends in machining techniques, material applications and competitive brands information as necessary.

  


**Marginal / Less Essential Job Functions**


* Assist KSPT-G in indexable tools tests and demonstrations.
* Assist Marketing, Sales, Inventory Control and Customer Service teams from product development and application engineering perspective.
* Attending professional seminars and trade shows to remain abreast of R&D methodologies in the tool industry.
* Complete required trip reports, expense reports and other required documentation as directed.
* Required to learn and use CAM and related programs as needed. Will have strong interaction with tool testing associates.

  


*Note: This description reflects the principal functions of the position for the purpose of job evaluation. Associate must adhere to changes in job requirements.*

  


**Educational Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent from college or technical school; or seven to ten years of trade school, vocational education, work experience, and apprenticeship training as related to the fields of machine trades and/or Indexable tool manufacturing and application.
* Mechanical engineering degree a plus in addition to the above requirements.
* High school diploma or GED.
* Ability to read, write, and communicate in English.

  


**Other Qualifications Desired**



Training & Experience


* 5 or more years of tooling application knowledge
* Understanding of cutting tool design, cutting tool grades, CNC machines, inspection equipment, and ability to read blueprints and CAD drawings.
* Basic knowledge of manufacturing processes for indexable tool
* Extensive experience of assisting end-users on problem analysis and problem resolution
* Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
* Basic knowledge with PC, Microsoft applications and hand-held communication devices
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
* Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
* Ability to speak effectively in front of groups of customers or associates of organizations.
* Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking, mathematical concepts including statistical reference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry.
* Travel is required as necessary.

  


**Benefits**


* 401(k)
* 10 Paid Holidays
* Paid Vacation
* Cafeteria Medical Plan
* Dental & Vision
* Benefits active on 31st
* Company Paid Life & Disability Insurance
* FSA
* Wellness Program
* Generous Associate Referral Program
* Training & Development Specialist on Staff
* Tuition Reimbursement

  


**License Required**



Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license and meet requirements set by
  

KSPT-G insurance carrier.

  


**Visual Acuity**



Must be able to visually examine tooling samples under varying magnification and read mechanical/tool drawings, precision measuring instruments and computer screens with or without accommodation.

  


**Hearing Ability**



Ability to monitor machine sounds to identify correct grinding conditions with or without reasonable accommodation.

  


**Working Conditions**



Normal office environment utilizing personal computer, phone, and related office equipment. May sit or stand as needed. Position subject to occasional light to medium lifting (up to 50lbs), carrying, pushing, pulling, reaching, and bending. Constant use of upper extremities. Occasional reaching above shoulder height, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents or store materials throughout the workday. Occasional exposure to moving mechanical parts, or other hazards associated with a manufacturing environment. Extensive travel is required.

  


**Additional Comments**


* Associate is required to follow other job-related duties, subject to all local, state, and federal laws and applicable regulations.
* The incumbent must successfully perform all requirements of the position training plan.


**When overtime is scheduled, it is mandatory.**


**FLSA Status**: Exempt

title: Thermal Engineer
description:
AST SpaceMobile and our global partners are building the first and only space-based cellular broadband network to be accessible by standard smartphones. Called SpaceMobile, this ultra-powerful network is being designed to provide connectivity at 4G/5G speeds everywhere on the planet – on land, at sea and in flight.

**Summary:**



The successful Thermal Engineer will work satellite thermal subsystem & payload non-recurring and recurring/sustaining efforts and activities including systems engineering, design, analysis, assembly, and testing. The successful candidate will be innovative, creative, and challenge the status quo. They will work well in teams while also having the ability to lead a small team and to work assignments autonomously.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Thermal hardware design, analysis and test (Spacecraft Structure, Avionics development support, MLI blankets, venting, heat pipes, sensors, etc)
* Document creation and management.
* Database creation and maintenance.
* Interfacing with manufacturing group to monitor component production progress
* Interfacing with integration and test group to monitor component integration
* Compilation of comprehensive parts lists using information from Bills of Materials (BOMs), engineering drawings, online databases, and data from subcontractors and suppliers
* Develop and maintain thermal design documentation at system and payload equipment level: analysis reports, interface control drawings, test procedures and tooling (Thermal Cycling, TVAC, assembly), manufacturing drawings.
* Derive subsystem environmental and test requirements from the top-level spacecraft requirements
* Perform post test/flight thermal model correlation
* Troubleshoot and investigate component anomalies and failures, perform root-cause analysis, and provide resolution.
* Develop thermal and subsystem test plans and procedures, identify hardware needs, design of test set-ups.
* Technical support for production and testing of satellites and the associated hardware.


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* BS in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar technical field.
* 5 years of experience as administrator with PDM software (preferably AutoDesk Vault).
* Working knowledge of PLM interaction with CAD software (AutoDesk Inventor/Fusion 360 preferred).
* 5 years of experience using AutoDesk Inventor.
* 5 years of experience in Defense/Aerospace Industry.
* Proficient with CAD software and use in mechanical and electrical engineering processes.
* Knowledge of the product development process, material specification data and product BOM structures.
* Experience in migrating and implementing new CAD and PDM/PLM software.
* Working knowledge of CAD license management.
* Working knowledge of CAD software administration and installation.
* Familiar with Product Lifecycle Development Processes and configuration control (revisions, release level, approvals).
* Demonstrated ability to work in a multidisciplinary team with other engineers.
* Flexibility/adaptability in a fast-paced & dynamic environment.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in thermal design, integration, and testing of spacecraft.
* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related technical field. Higher degree is preferred.
* Strong technical skill in Thermal analysis using Thermal Desktop, thermal hardware, thermal testing, multi-layer insulation, integration, testing, spacecraft, manufacturing, Bill of materials, subcontractor oversight.
* Demonstrated ability to work in a multidisciplinary team with other engineers.
* Flexibility/adaptability in a fast-paced & dynamic environment.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
* Basic programming skills are preferred.

title: Mechanical Engineer - Data Centers (US remote)
description:
*Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.*  

  

*Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.*

  

  

**Your Impact:**  

At Jacobs, we don’t settle – always looking beyond to raise the bar and deliver with excellence. We apply our expertise and knowledge as we look into the future with great optimism and focus. We don’t settle until we give our best and know that we’re making a difference.

  



We're looking for a **Mechanical Engineer** - **Data Centers** who is excited about working on projects that enable the heart of our client's business. Join us and you’ll have the chance to work on projects at some of the world’s most state of the art industrial and commercial facilities. You’ll be accountable for schedule and technical quality of challenging engineering tasks, as you gain familiarity with the client’s expectations, scope, budget, and schedule. Ideal candidate will be located in the southwest region, but U.S. based candidates capable of working remote and traveling 10-15% will also be considered.

  



You will work in a multi-discipline, highly interactive team to successfully deliver on the design, development, application, evaluation, recommendation, and specification of engineered systems and products for building HVAC, Plumbing, and Fire Protection Systems. You will perform all aspects of mechanical engineering and design and independently apply advanced engineering techniques and analysis within the discipline. You will also develop designs that require innovation and ingenuity, be expected to perform work with little to no supervision, review work of discipline team for adequacy on completion and provide technical guidance to drafters/designers and engineers.

  



Your role keeps our company connected and we’ll support you with what you need to be successful. Bring your creativity, ambitious spirit and extreme attention to detail, and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can deliver extraordinary solutions for a better tomorrow, together.


**Here’s What You’ll Need:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
* Professional Engineer (PE) Registration
* At least 5 years of practical application of mechanical engineering, including HVAC, fire protection, plumbing, piping, boiler, chiller, or related mechanical building systems
* At least 2 years of data center experience
* At least 2 years of data center experience

  

**Ideally, you’ll also have:**


* Effective communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills
* Experience leading junior engineers and designers on complex multi-discipline design project from concept development through detail design and construction
* Working knowledge of Navisworks and Revit
* Ability to be forward thinking, learn best practices, and contribute with innovative ideas
* Ability to collaborate and work effectively in multi-disciplinary teams

  

#afelectronics #mechanicalengineer #datacenter #LI-remote


At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.


Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Eligible employees and their dependents may elect medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan, and if eligible, a deferred compensation plan, and Executive Deferral Plan. We have an unlimited U.S. Personalized Paid Time Off (PPTO) policy for eligible full-time exempt employees, seven paid holidays, one floating holiday, and caregiver leave. Hired applicants will be able to purchase company stock and have the opportunity to receive a performance discretionary bonus. The base salary for this position is $96,400 - $150,550. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations if remote. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

  

  

*At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $15 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 60,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.*

title: Field Performance Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


Becoming Vernova  

Looking to make a global impact and solve problems?
  

  

Through relentless innovation and continuous collaboration with our customers, GE Gas Power, part of GE Vernova, is providing more advanced, cleaner, and efficient power that people depend on today and building the energy technologies of the future.  

  

  

  

A gas turbine performance test engineer will be executing highly technical services on various gas turbine models. The successful execution of these global services will require that the engineer adhere to internal processes while being open to challenges that may arise. Engineers are accountable for the quality our customers feel when purchasing our services. Areas of customer quality include accurate/timely documentation, appropriate/timely installation of instrumentation, accurate collection of field data, various site activities, and communications.  

The position requires approximately 50% travel in 2 to 6 week intervals, to destinations around the world. \\*\\* This is an estimate; travel requirements vary, with peak outage seasons seeing higher percentages and peak demand seasons seeing less travel.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Review commercial guarantees, test expectations/requirements, and develop performance test procedures.
* Prepare, plan, and execute thermal performance tests on gas turbines.
* Analyze data, calculate test results, diagnose and evaluate testing issues and develop corrective actions as needed.
* Prepare test reports for internal and external distribution
* Communicate with internal and external customers regarding testing activities, schedules, and technical issues.
* Identify and report in-field sales opportunities.
* Support continued development and improvement of performance tools/processes.
* Support new service development initiatives.

**Basic Qualifications**

* A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or other Engineering major with a strong thermo-dynamic foundation.

**Eligibility Requirements**

* The position requires approximately 50% travel in 2-to-6-week intervals, to destinations around the world. This is an estimate; travel requirements vary, with peak outage seasons seeing higher percentages and peak demand seasons seeing less travel.

**Desired Characteristics**

* Strong understanding of thermodynamics and thermodynamic cycles as they relate to gas turbines.
* Prior experience in gas turbine performance testing and analysis
* Training or proficiency in gas turbine and thermodynamics.
* Experience with modeling and analysis programs for gas turbines.
* Advanced degree in Engineering.
* Proficient in the use of computers and PC software.
* Excellent communications skills - both verbal and written.
* Strong interpersonal skills – self starter
* Customer focused; Team focused.

**About Us**

**Inclusion & Diversity** At GE, we believe in the value of your unique identity, background, and experiences. We are committed to fostering an **inclusive** **culture**, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work because they feel accepted, respected and that they belong.


Click here to learn more: https://jobs.gecareers.com/global/en/diversity-at-ge

**For U.S. based candidates only,** for purposes of complying with U.S. pay transparency requirements, the base pay range for this position is $69,600 - 87,000 USD Annual**.**


The specific pay offered may be influenced by a variety of factors, including the candidate’s experience, education, and skill set. This position is also eligible for a Variable Incentive Bonus of 5%.

* The Company pays a geographic differential of 110%, 120% or 130% of salary in certain areas.


This position will stay open on the career website until at least 2/22/2024.

**Benefits Available to You:**


GE employees rise to the challenge of building a world that works. In order to meet this mission, we provide varied, competitive benefits to help support our workforce: https://jobs.gecareers.com/global/en/ge-career-benefits

* Our **compensation & benefits** are designed to help you manage your personal and family needs, while rewarding high performers. We offer a robust benefits package depending on your employment status and your national requirements.
* A **healthy, balanced lifestyle** can mean different things to different people. We've created programs that support the way you live and work today.
* GE invests to provide opportunities to **grow your career** by providing a path for continued on-the-job **learning and development**.

**Healthcare benefit**s include medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage; access to a Health Coach, a 24/7 nurse-based resource; and access to the Employee Assistance Program, providing 24/7 confidential assessment, counseling, and referral services.

**Retirement benefits** include the GE Retirement Savings Plan, a tax-advantaged 401(k) savings opportunity with company matching contributions and company retirement contributions, as well as access to Fidelity resources and planning consultants.

**Other benefits** include tuition assistance, adoption assistance, paid parental leave, disability insurance, life insurance, and paid time-off for vacation or illness.


General Electric Company, Ropcor, Inc., their successors, and in some cases their affiliates, each sponsor certain employee benefit plans or programs (i.e., is a “Sponsor”). Each Sponsor reserves the right to terminate, amend, suspend, replace, or modify its benefit plans and programs at any time and for any reason, in its sole discretion. No individual has a vested right to any benefit under a Sponsor’s welfare benefit plan or program. This document does not create a contract of employment with any individual.
