title: Machinery Engineer
description:
**Machinery Engineer**
**About the company:** https://www.machinerypartner.com/

Machinery Partner is on a mission to build the Amazon for Industrial Equipment. This sector was previously underserved by technology and had one hundred billion in transaction volume in the US last year. We are changing how small and growing industrial businesses buy large pieces of complex equipment and finance their expansion, starting with industrial recycling in the US. Machinery Partner brings the best of the tech ecosystem to industrial businesses that build physical products with large, heavy, complex pieces of equipment and make our modern physical world run.
**Your Role:*** Share your love of heavy equipment and crushers with new operators and service technicians.
* You can turn a wrench and teach others how to maintain and operate their machines.


- Build strong customer relationships with both end-user customers and dealers. - This will include regular visits to dealers and customers to obtain direct feedback.* Build and maintain a remote Service Tech network to support customers throughout their lifecycle.
* Build and keep a Service and support team with bar raisers collaborating with team members that strive for excellence.
* Provide application support for the Machinery product range and assist in developing and delivering customer sales proposals.
* Work in the marketplace to identify new product opportunities. Strategically work with Marketing, Business Development, and Product to revolutionize the industry.
* Work directly with our suppliers and equipment manufacturers (a.k.a. OEM vendors) to quickly resolve technical questions regarding the machines.
* You use data (field visits and support ticket volume) to help OEMs improve their models, reducing service costs and warranty claims.

 **What You Will Do:*** Travel to customer sites to set up and install new machines for our customers.
* Handle customer support calls and triage issues.
* Use your experience from the field to resolve customer issues as quickly as possible.
* Coordinate parts delivery and service calls to minimize customer downtime.


Order, ship, and upsell features and services.
* Maintain the physical and virtual warehouses of parts and equipment.
* Manage and keep current customer records (support tickets, customer portal, etc.), including service tech scheduling, job completion, and payment.

 **Who you Are:*** Experience tracking service tech work orders for repairs in the field
* Experience sourcing and identifying fulfillment needs.
* Five years experience working with customers.
* Experience with support calls and helping triage issues.
* Bachelor's degree preferred but not required.
* Ability to travel (25-50%)

 **Above and Beyond:*** Experience with heavy equipment, machinery, OEM, and dealer networks.
* Experience with modern technology and business tools


**Your Success Matrix:*** Parts are supplied with every order for each piece of equipment sold.
* Develop a customer satisfaction survey with our Director of Support and Service.
* On-time parts delivery based on defined KPI.
* Customer satisfaction is 80% or higher based on survey results.

 **Our Benefits:**
* Hybrid Work Environment
* Incentive Bonus Plans
* 100% Medical and Dental benefits
* 401K
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Employee Stock Plan
* Paid Parental & Family Leave
* and more!

 **EEO Statement:**

Machinery Partner is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Sr. Engineer, Mechanical
description:
**We are Thinkers That Do!**  

Delivering innovative solutions to our clients requires the best people. At WD, architects, engineers, designers, and strategists work together to impact national and global brands. With over 400 talented associates worldwide, WD is licensed in all 50 states and Canada. We provide an environment where associates gain experience, train and mentor with the best, and build a successful career!  

  

We currently have an opening for a Senior Mechanical Engineer. We are open to hiring for remote work in any location within the US, but candidates who are local to Dublin, OH would be able to work in our office and/or remote.  

  

As a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you are responsible for ensuring technical accuracy of work in the production of construction documents for our clients, through managing other associates. In this role, you will also create advanced engineering designs when needed and assist team members with solution development. Your primary focus will be championing the use of best practices, adherence to company standards, accuracy of construction documents, and technical discipline coordination.  

  

Professional Engineer (PE) licensure is required for this title. If you're not a licensed engineer, please check our postings for opportunities as a Designer.  

  

Preferred Experience:  

* Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
* Licensed Professional Engineer (PE)
* Mechanical design experience specifically related to the production of construction documents
* Prior experience with staff leadership and resource allocation
* Experience with restaurant, grocery, retail and/or healthcare projects
* Experience coordinating with multi-disciplined architecture and engineering teams
* Experience using AutoCAD and Revit


What matters to our associates matters to us. Benefits and professional growth are at the top of the list. We provide a comprehensive benefits package that encourages our associates to live healthy lifestyles, reach financial goals, and cope with the challenges of life at work and home. We like to work hard and have fun!  

  

Check us out on www.wdpartners.com and on Instagram. You will find an opportunity to collaborate with smart, down-to-earth people who innovate with national and global brands and grow every day!

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
Company

thyssenkrupp System Engineering, Inc. develops, designs and manufactures turn-key powertrain assembly systems and battery systems, including gauging and testing technology for worldwide automotive manufacturers and their supplier industry. thyssenkrupp System Engineering is based in Auburn Hills, Michigan.


**Your responsibilities**
-------------------------


**Summary:**
Performs and coordinates activities to develop assembly concepts for assembly stations and/or assembly concepts for aspects of assembly lines to establish reliable and cost effective solutions with the goal of improving quality, timing and cost. Executes the mechanical design of an assigned project, from initial project kick-off through installation, while working with project core team.


**Duties and Responsibilities (not all inclusive)**


* Compliance with company, legal, and regulatory requirements for Health, Safety, and Environmental topics in order to foster a culture of Health & Safety.
* Performs and coordinates design activities in the early phase of a project, simultaneous engineering, and project follow up, including concept development, feasibility studies, reference research, and product layout design.
* Develops mechanical-related primary specifications for projects; also assists and shares ownership of project station specifications.
* Works with project core team to develop and share ownership of project timing, as well as ensuring Workfront tasks are up to date.
* Develops design concepts and completes designs for stations with a high degree of complexity.
* Development of standard assembly units of an assembly line in the early phase of a project in compliance with project specifications, Company standards, customer requirements, and engineering principles.
* Reviews and improves design concepts for compliance with engineering principles, Company standards, customer requirements, and specifications.
* Lines-up and leads designers and detailers (internal and/or external) to successfully execute designs.
* Checks feasibility and cost effectiveness of proposed design concepts.
* Takes responsibility for the quality and completeness of design for assigned areas.
* Regular attendance at the assigned job site(s).

**Your profile**
----------------


**Education and/or Experience**


Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in a related field from a 4-year college or university, with 5 plus years of related experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


**Other Skills and Abilities**


* Design capability using Inventor 3D and/or Solidworks 3D, and AutoCAD 2D is required.
* Experience with automation design, powertrain assembly system design, battery assembly system design, or special machine design is required
* Working knowledge of product lifecycle management software.
* Working knowledge of project scheduling software (i.e. Workfront).
* Working knowledge of GD&T.
* Ability to understand customer and applicable international standard requirements.

thyssenkrupp System Engineering, Inc. offers a full benefit package including: Vacation, 401k with company match, educational reimbursement, Medical coverage, Flex Spending, and Company provided dental, vision, life, short term and long term disability insurances.

title: Mechanical Engineer - Vehicle Accident Reconstruction - Orlando, FL
description:
We are currently seeking an additional experienced Mechanical Engineer, preferably with vehicle accident reconstruction (VAR), to support operations in our Orlando, Florida office.



In this position, the vehicle accident reconstructionist will apply their technical knowledge in the performance of vehicle accident reconstruction and investigate failures involving vehicle systems (brakes, transmission, throttle, steering, etc.)


**Essential Job Functions**


* Reconstructing vehicular accidents using engineering analysis, CAE-based tools and test data where appropriate.
* Responsibilities will include analyzing single and multiple-vehicle collisions, speeds, roadway drag factors, perception-response times, lamp analysis, time-distance relationships, etc.
* The Vehicle Accident Reconstructionist will perform timely, accurate analysis, prepare reports and present your findings to the client and other interested parties.
* The Vehicle Accident Reconstructionist will also prepare and present demonstrative diagrams and charts and provide an analysis of the cause of various incidents.
* Work involves documenting and preserving evidence obtained, preparing written reports of findings, and providing expert testimony in litigation as necessary.
* Provide collision scene evidence analysis and forensic mapping of collision sites and vehicles.
* Evaluate cars, trucks, or other various forms of transportation.
* Performing damage analysis, speeds from damage (energy), coefficient of friction of roadway, time and distance relationships, lamp analysis, occupant kinematics, vehicle dynamics, perception and response times, braking efficiency of air brake systems on commercial motor vehicles, and possibly intersection traffic signal analysis.
* Inspect and analyze automotive or mechanical parts to determine the cause of failure.
* Analyze product liability, design, and safety.
* Perform other duties as requested.

  


**Qualifications**


* BS in Mechanical Engineering required.
* Florida PE Required.
* 8+ years of experience.
* Must have strong technical writing skills.
* ACTAR certification must be obtained within first year.
* You must be able to gain P.E. reciprocity in additional states as needed.
* Physically able to climb ladders, walk on uneven and unleveled surfaces, enter and work in confined spaces, crawl under cars and trucks and other vehicles to inspect damage.

  


**Physical Demands, Overtime, and Travel Requirements**


**Physical Demands** - Work is performed both in an office setting and at outside locations (i.e. accident sites). Employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, climb, bend, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk, hear, and drive a motor vehicle to job sites. Employee may lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Employee must be sharp, focused, and alert when conducting site inspections, speaking and interacting with clients, preparing written reports of findings, and testifying in deposition or trial. Clear vision and depth perception are also necessary.


**Overtime** - This position is classified as salaried with an exempt FLSA status. Regular working hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, with one hour for lunch. There will be periods where overtime will be required, which the employee will need to comply with in order to meet the demands of the position.


**Travel Requirements** - This position requires up to 25% travel. Some out-of-area and overnight travel may be required.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
Description: **Who We Are**


Norwest Engineering is a multi-discipline, consulting engineering firm focused on developing long-standing relationships with our clients. We are a team of talented, hard working individuals with a wide variety of experience in many industries. To succeed at Norwest, our engineers must be comfortable wearing many hats and taking ownership of tasks assigned to them. We are a company of finishers, taking pride in our ability to create progress on our client's projects.


Since 1975, Norwest has established a culture of cultivating trusted partnerships with our clients. We look forward to continuing the tradition of Responsiveness, Accuracy, and Quality Engineering for years to come. Norwest specializes in heavy industrial engineering, focusing on petroleum, chemical, power generation, pulp & paper, and metal manufacturing facilities.

**What We Offer**


One of the benefits of being a Norwest employee is our company culture. Each day we strive to embody our core values. We work hard, have fun, believe in work/life balance, and have passion for our clients and their visions. Through flexible work arrangements, group benefit offerings, and a casual work environment, we strive to differentiate ourselves from other consulting engineering firms. The flexible work arrangements include flexible work hours and compressed workweeks. Our benefit offerings include group health, dental, and vision insurance; as well as life insurance, and short and long-term disability insurance. We credit our successful history and optimistic future to the quality of our employees. We work hard to find individuals with the work ethic and character to match our core values.

**What You’d Be Doing**


As a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you have the opportunity to take ownership of small/medium projects and to complete mechanical engineering and project management tasks with little oversight from senior management. You will have an opportunity to lead, inspire, and mentor team members by living Norwest's core values and becoming a strong Norwest brand ambassador.

* Review, understand, develop, and check Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID’s) ortho-graphics, isometrics, bill of materials, pipeline lists, valve lists, and tie-in lists for piping design projects incorporating your familiarity with piping design in process environments.
* Estimate costs of completing projects (engineering costs and total installed construction costs).
* Take ownership and manage project costs.
* Understand pumping, piping, air and liquid flow and distribution systems; apply these principles to create a sound engineering design.
* Complete mechanical engineering calculations such as:
	+ Hydraulic calculations to size pumps and piping, determine NPSH, etc.
	+ Heat loss calculations for piping, tanks and other equipment.
	+ Simple structural beam calculations for pipe supports, etc.
* Apply relevant codes such as:
	+ ASME B31.3, B31.4, B31.8.
	+ API 650, 653 and other related standards.
	+ NFPA 11, 30 and other related standards.
* Perform pipe stress analysis using Caesar II software in accordance with ASME B31.3 and B31.4.
* Develop mechanical engineering documents according to industry, project, and company standards including P&ID’s, general arrangements, equipment installation details, tank data sheets, tie-in procedures, and piping design while leading other engineers and designers.
* Take ownership and responsibility of all drawings, documents, schedules, and budgets.
* Prepare technical specifications for review and approval.
* Evaluate vendor bids and drawings to assure compliance with specifications and project requirements.
* Provide project management for projects that are primarily mechanical in nature demonstrating the ability to:
	+ Be the primary point of contact for a client, and suggest solutions based on minimal information when a client calls to discuss a project.
	+ Lead weekly internal and client meetings.
	+ Prepare and communicate weekly meeting agendas and minutes.
	+ Take ownership of project schedule and budget.
* Ability to effectively interact on a basic technical level with other engineering disciplines and understand how their work impacts the overall project; regular contact is expected with other disciplines.
* Ability to review electrical, civil, and structural drawings to ensure coordination and check for interference(s) with the mechanical drawings.
* Effectively collect field notes based on trips to client's sites.

**What Makes You a Good Candidate for This Position**

* 8+ years of experience in the completion of projects for clients in the industrial market sector including project development from concept through completion, including estimating, start-up and commissioning.
	+ Relevant experience includes oil and gas, refinery, pulp and paper, or other industrial environments.
	+ Technical field experience is relevant; our team spends time with clients at their site.
	+ Project development from concept through construction, including start-up and commissioning
* BS in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) or Chemical Engineering (BSChemE) required.
* PE (Professional Engineer) registration desired; must be working toward or be willing to obtain PE.
* Experience designing industrial piping systems and equipment layouts.
* Experience estimating mechanical engineering labor and associated cost and total installed construction costs for the mechanical aspects of the project is required.
* Experience leading multiple disciplines in assembling a total installed cost estimate (+/- 30%) for an entire project is preferred.
* Strong background providing a combination of both project management and engineering skills and a high comfort level with taking ownership and leading small/medium projects that are mechanically focused with little to no managerial oversight.
* Strong desire to grow in project management, managing all sizes of projects.
* Experience running projects using MS Project or similar tool is strongly preferred.
* Strong written and oral communication skills.
* Strong computer skills including the use of MS Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel), web meeting software (Teams, WebEx, GoTo Meeting, etc.), and PDF markup software (Bluebeam Revu or Adobe Acrobat).
* Experience with Navisworks Freedom, Simulate or Manage is preferred.
* Basic knowledge of CAD software terminology, methods, and practices; ability to operate CAD software is not required.
* Solid listening skills and ability to think "outside the box" are a must to allow our team to come up with creative solutions to match the client’s needs and budgets
* Capable and willing to promote Norwest by intentionally seeking out new work with existing and prospective clients.
* Self-motivated, able to work independently as well as lead a team with energy and enthusiasm.
* Have a desire to seek continuous improvement of personal and team skill-set.
* Strong leadership skills and problem resolution skills.
* Ability and willingness to serve as primary customer liaison, serve as a subject matter expert in front of clients and to work within the team of engineers and designers to achieve client objectives.
* Ability to travel approximately 10-25% of the time throughout the West, Northwest and nationally.
* Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States at the time of application for employment-Norwest Engineering does not sponsor employment visas.


Salary Range: $110,000 to $130,000 depending on relevant experience.


Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Life, and Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance, Vacation, Holiday, and Paid Sick Time, and 401k Plan with Employer Match


If you believe you’d be a good fit for our team, please submit your resume


Requirements:  

* 8+ years of experience in the completion of projects for clients in the industrial market sector including project development from concept through completion, including estimating, start-up and commissioning.
	+ Relevant experience includes oil and gas, refinery, pulp and paper, or other industrial environments.
	+ Technical field experience is relevant; our team spends time with clients at their site.
	+ Project development from concept through construction, including start-up and commissioning
* BS in Mechanical Engineering (BSME) or Chemical Engineering (BSChemE) required.
* PE (Professional Engineer) registration desired; must be working toward or be willing to obtain PE.
* Experience designing industrial piping systems and equipment layouts.
* Experience estimating mechanical engineering labor and associated cost and total installed construction costs for the mechanical aspects of the project is required.
* Experience leading multiple disciplines in assembling a total installed cost estimate (+/- 30%) for an entire project is preferred.
* Strong background providing a combination of both project management and engineering skills and a high comfort level with taking ownership and leading small/medium projects that are mechanically focused with little to no managerial oversight.
* Strong desire to grow in project management, managing all sizes of projects.
* Experience running projects using MS Project or similar tool is strongly preferred.
* Strong written and oral communication skills.
* Strong computer skills including the use of MS Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel), web meeting software (Teams, WebEx, GoTo Meeting, etc.), and PDF markup software (Bluebeam Revu or Adobe Acrobat).
* Experience with Navisworks Freedom, Simulate or Manage is preferred.
* Basic knowledge of CAD software terminology, methods, and practices; ability to operate CAD software is not required.
* Solid listening skills and ability to think "outside the box" are a must to allow our team to come up with creative solutions to match the client’s needs and budgets
* Capable and willing to promote Norwest by intentionally seeking out new work with existing and prospective clients.
* Self-motivated, able to work independently as well as lead a team with energy and enthusiasm.
* Have a desire to seek continuous improvement of personal and team skill-set.
* Strong leadership skills and problem resolution skills.
* Ability and willingness to serve as primary customer liaison, serve as a subject matter expert in front of clients and to work within the team of engineers and designers to achieve client objectives.
* Ability to travel approximately 10-25% of the time throughout the West, Northwest and nationally.
* Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States at the time of application for employment-Norwest Engineering does not sponsor employment visas.

title: Project Engineer Mechanical
description:
Company

thyssenkrupp System Engineering, Inc. develops, designs and manufactures turn-key powertrain assembly systems and battery systems, including gauging and testing technology for worldwide automotive manufacturers and their supplier industry. thyssenkrupp System Engineering is based in Auburn Hills, Michigan.


**Your responsibilities**
-------------------------


**Summary:** The Project Engineer Mechanical (PEM) is a member of the core project team; the core project team is comprised of the Project Manager (PM), Project Engineer Mechanical (PEM), and Project Engineer Controls (PEC). This team will be the leadership for the execution of the project. The PEM is responsible for managing, coordinating, or controlling the mechanical engineering work packages throughout the assigned project.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities
* Compliance with company, legal, and regulatory requirements for Health, Safety, and Environmental topics in order to foster a culture of Health & Safety.
* Responsible for coordinating technical matters, quality, cost, and scheduling mainly for the mechanical engineering work packages.
* As member of Project Core Team, will be customer point of contact for all mechanical designs, studies, issues, etc.
* Drawing up and maintaining costs and scheduling overviews, as well as technical/commercial reporting to the project management and line organization.
* Works with project core team to develop and share ownership of project timing, as well as ensuring Workfront tasks are up to date.
* Supports in cost negotiations with customers and suppliers.
* Leading and supporting communications between departments, the core team, suppliers, and customers in regards to assigned projects.
* Review and improve design concepts for compliance with engineering principles, company standards, customer requirements and specifications.
* Responsible for creating mechanical engineering execution documentation (safety concept, primary specifications, customer specifications, long leads releases, etc.) and getting the customer approval.
* Line-up and lead designers and detailers (internal and/or external) to successfully execute designs.
* Ensuring preparation of the mechanical engineering related project and process documentation. (ex. Spare/Wear info for internal/external and Tier 2 suppliers)
* Check feasibility and cost effectiveness of proposed design concepts.

**Your profile**
----------------


**Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in a related field from a 4-year college or university with at least 5 years of related experience; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
* The individual must have the ability to execute engineering design for the product using 2D and 3D CAD software (Inventor or Solidworks, and AutoCAD)
* Past work experience in design of powertrain assembly or battery assembly systems.

title: Control Systems Engineer - EV Thermal Management
description:
AKG is the cooler place to work! We are a privately owned manufacturing company located in Mebane, NC. Our 100+ year old business is growing within the heat exchanger industry and we are looking for result driven, goal oriented and enthusiastic individuals who want to grow with and within the organization. AKG offers more than Medical, Dental and Vision benefits; we offer company paid plans of STD, LTD, Life Insurance, the 401k Match is top notch and there is an onsite Cone Health clinic for health concerns.



As a Control Systems Engineer, you will be with AKG's customer designing and developing control systems for a variety of different applications from On/Off-highway to power generation/industrial.



Control Systems Engineer responsibilities will include:


* Develop thermal control strategies for EV - full-electric and hybrid system powertrains
* Develop requirements, interfaces and control algorithm's for thermal management systems to communicate with vehicle master controller and BMS/other electronic devices via CAN tools
* Calibrate, test and validate control features to support various powertrain system architecture's (SIL, HIL and vehicle testing)
* Develop different control modes/operating states for programming controller applications) using Matlab simulink or Codesys
* Research and develop methods for remote monitoring, troubleshooting and gather data to investigate field issues
* Create new documentation and revise existing CAN operating states
* Perform unit testing during the development process and utilize agile methodologies to support rapid prototyping timelines
* Debug software codes and propose solutions to customers throughout the product life-cycle
* Interact with customers, suppliers and cross-functional teams to gain understanding of the requirements and communicate deliverables/results
* Write reports, create presentations and deliver technical solutions to customers
* Research and influence the future path, trends and developments of controls for E-powertrains and communicate to senior team members
* Attend conferences, trade shows and field issues to build efficient development methods

#### **Experience**


Required* 1 - 3 years: Experience developing controls for electro-mechanical systems including PWM drivers, DC motors
* 1 - 2 years: Knowledge of remote monitoring, troubleshooting, telematics and IOT
* 1 - 3 years: Knowledge of CAN communication protocols such as ISO144229/CANJ1939 standards
* 2 - 5 years: Experience with programming controls for industrial/mobile applications with CAN development tools - CANalyzer, Vector CANape, and model based controls using Matlab Simulink


Preferred* Knowledge of C programming language and AUTOSAR is preferred
* Experience with PID loops and HMI programming
* Knowledge of NFPA70e and high voltage safety systems
* Technical experience relating to design and diagnostics of electronic test stands
* 2 - 5 years: Experience developing controls for hydraulic circuits and motion controls is preferred

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelors or better in Electrical Engineering or related field
* Bachelors or better in Computer Science or related field

#### **Behaviors**


Preferred* Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
* Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking
* Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

#### **Motivations**


Preferred* Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
* Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
* Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

title: Remote PRA Engineer
description:
Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports Westinghouse’s mission to provide clean energy solutions? At Westinghouse, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.



If this sounds like an environment you would thrive in, we have an exciting opportunity for a **Remote PRA Engineer** (Probabilistic Risk Assessments).  

  

**Your Day-to-Day:**


* Perform Probabilistic Risk Assessments (PRA) for complex nuclear power plant systems evaluating plants potential vulnerability to all risk and hazard types (i.e., seismic, fire, flooding, etc.) for domestic and international plants
* Lead project teams effectively contributing to the technical execution as well as the schedule and financial objectives
* Support and identify strategic initiatives, develop product offerings and pursue target product markets
* Present technical topics and interface with global customers and regulatory bodies
* Develop and support innovation products from conception through marketing and delivery

  




**Who You Are:**  

**As a successful candidate, you will bring the following to the team:**


* Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Nuclear, or Chemical)
* US Citizen or Permanent Resident (Visa Sponsoship not available for this position).
* Professional Engineer License considered a plus
* Experience with PRA Model development applied to nuclear plants
* Knowledge of PWR reactor operation
* In addition to basic Risk and Hazard skills, should have a strong knowledge of
	+ Internal/External Hazards PRAs;
	+ Level 2 PRAs;
	+ Human Reliability Analysis (HRA)
	+ Emergency Operating Procedures (EOPs)
* Proficiency with PRA software (CAFTA, RiskSpectrum);
* Peer Review experience

  


  

**Why Westinghouse?**


**Westinghouse Electric Company is the global nuclear energy industry’s first choice for safe, clean, and efficient energy solutions. We enable our delivery of this vision by living our value system:**


* Safety and Quality
* Integrity and Trust
* Customer Focus and Innovation
* Speed and Passion to Win
* Teamwork and Accountability


**Westinghouse offers competitive benefits to all our employees around the globe to keep them healthy and enhance their well-being. In the U.S. the following are representative of what we offer:**


* Competitive Salary
* Comprehensive Health, Wellness and Income Protection Benefits
* 401(k) Savings Plan with Company Match
* Paid Vacations and Holidays
* Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements
* Educational Reimbursement Program
* Employee Referral Program


**While our Global Headquarters are located in Cranberry Township, PA, we have over 9,000 employees working at locations in 19 different countries. You can learn more by visiting** **http://www.westinghousenuclear.com****.**

**EOE of Minorities / Females / Vets / Disability.**

title: Digital Thread Applications Engineer
description:
Intercax’s mission is to innovate software that fundamentally advances computer-based modeling, integration, and analyses of complex systems. Our technology is helping transition the industry from disconnected engineering silos to an integrated model-based engineering environment backed by enterprise-scale and secure digital threads. From spacecraft and avionics to automotive, energy, healthcare, and manufacturing, our digital thread technology is paving the future of digital engineering.



Intercax is opening a new position – **Digital Thread Applications Engineer** – with the following specifics.


**Location**



(1) Candidate must be a US citizen or US Permanent Resident



(2) Fully remote, work anywhere in the US, occasional travel to user meetings and conferences


**Roles and Responsibilities**



(1) Build and demonstrate live digital threads in multiple industry domains – aerospace, automotive, energy, biomedical/healthcare, marine, mechatronics, manufacturing, and cybersecurity.



(2) Integrate data/models from multiple disciplines, such as below, to build real and live digital threads.


* SysML/UAF/UML modeling tools, including SysML v2
* Requirements management tools
* Hardware design and development, such as PLM, CAD/CAE systems
* Software design and development, such as ALM, Software Version Control, and IDE systems
* Analysis and Simulation environments
* Verification and Test management systems
* Real-time Data Streams and Databases
* Data Science and Notebook platforms


(3) Demonstrate digital thread methodologies and applications to end-users



(4) Provide technical support via our helpdesk, and gather end-user stories and challenges to help improve our products.



(5) Work closely with our software architecture and development team to provide test models and challenge scenarios, test the latest builds, and provide feedback on improving the usability and quality of our products.



(6) Develop whitepapers, blogs, and presentations showcasing live digital threads in multiple industry verticals. Publish on our company blog site, present directly to customers in-person or via web conferences, and at international conferences and workshops.


**Qualifications and Skills**

(1) Bachelors (BS/BE/BTech) or Masters (MS/ME/MTech) degree in engineering such as mechanical engineering, electronics/electrical engineering, computer engineering, robotics, manufacturing, or industrial engineering from a reputed university.



(2) 3-5 years of experience building and executing models in engineering tools related to Systems Modeling, PLM, CAD/CAE, Simulation, Verification/Test, Software Development, or Requirements management. Candidates must have an experience in at least three (3) areas listed above.



(3) 2-3 years of experience working directly with customers and delivering project work, such as software, engineering models, reports, and whitepapers.



(4) Excellent written and oral communication skills. Provide examples of conference papers, presentations, blogs, and other articles you have authored.



(5) Excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skills that can take on the toughest challenges and carve solutions. An aptitude and eagerness to learn new technologies and improve skill sets are essential for this position.



(6) An attitude to genuinely help people, to work patiently with them, and be their superhero.


**Team and Opportunity**



(1) Opportunity to work with leading global organizations in aerospace, automotive, transportation, healthcare, manufacturing, electronics, and other verticals.



(2) Fully remote. Focus your creative energies on work rather than commuting.



(3) Fast-paced environment with a global team of experts to help you learn new technologies.



(4) Excellent compensation package.



(5) Regular working hours (US ET) for work-life balance.



(6) Opportunities to travel to conferences/events to present your work, meet customers, and represent the company.


**To Apply**



Email your resume to jobs@intercax.com with the following details.



(1) The subject of the email should be in the following format “*Digital Thread Applications Engineer – <Your Full Name>*”, e.g. Digital Thread Applications Engineer – Jane Doe.



(2) The body of the email should contain a short paragraph (<10 lines) stating why you are a great fit for this position



(3) Don’t forget to attach your resume/CV as a PDF.



(4) Include links to conference presentations/papers, technical articles, blog posts, or Git repositories in your resume showcasing your applications engineering expertise.


**Learn more**



To learn more about Intercax and Syndeia, our digital thread platform for model-based engineering, visit:



(1) www.intercax.com



(2) www.syndeia.com



(3) Blog – https://intercax.com/blog



(4) YouTube – https://www.youtube.com/@Intercax

title: Author
description:
The ideal candidate is one which has a vehicle repair background on both mechanical and electronic vehicle systems plus is proficient with using a computer and has experience with software basic languages and have authored ISIP documents. Candidate could create logical steps to lead technicians to identify reasons for failure.


  
* Familiar with vehicle electronics architectures
* Familiar with vehicle mechanical architectures
* Familiar with software editors
* Experience with Arbotex ISIP Editor desired
* Experience with OTX and Grade X desired
* Strong problem solving skills
* Clear written/verbal communication skills
* Experience with Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel, Word)
* Understanding of vehicle communications protocols (CAN)
* Ideally hands on experience servicing or repairing vehicles or similar products
* Able to read, write and speak English as a minimum
* Good team player but also ability to focus and work alone to meet deadlines

  
* Work with Design engineers to understand vehicle electrical architecture, how it can fail and how it can be diagnosed
* Work with core team to determine if previously authored diagnostics can be leveraged or if new diagnostic pinpoint needs to be developed
* Utilises computer application software to design, develop, create and test the diagnostic routines for implementation on the Authorised Repairer (AR) diagnostic tool.
* Validates and signs-off diagnostics routines using simulation, rigs and vehicles as necessary
* Work with Design and Release engineers to resolve issues within Part 2 specifications
* Work with Technical Assistance Center to resolve diagnostic issues in the field

title: Engineering Designer
description:
**Career Area:**

Engineering
**Job Description:**

**Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.**

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.


**Responsibilities :** We are looking for Engineer – Deign for Cab team.


This position need to deliver higher complex projects, Key areas of responsibility encountered in the role of Engineer - Design are: taking care of end to end responsibilities of start from scratch design for structural and nonmetallic components to deliver the final product and address any build issues and or performance issues at field. Also work with manufacturing team& suppliers to develop the finalized designs. Also perform the Cab system Integrator and work with different subsystems to accommodate their design deliverables. Exhibit self-motivation, commitment, excellent communication skills and should be able to work with a wide cross-functional teams.


**Expertise:**

Required skills:


* Hands on experience in Design and Development of entire Cab system, Structural and Non Metallics Components.
* Hands on experience with Cab system integration / configuration.
* Strong Project Execution and Budget management experience
* Sound knowledge in APQP, CPPD activities
* Knowledge of Team Center, FEA for Design validation
* Strong knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD &T) and Tolerance Stack up analysis.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* 6 Sigma Green Belt Certified

This job might require around 20% traveling


Qualification :


* A master’s / Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical engineering

Experience :


* 9 -13 years

Relocation is available for this position.
**Posting Dates:**

March 6, 2024 - March 19, 2024
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Overview & Responsibilities
PURPOSE OF THE JOB:
The Mechanical Engineer's function is to ensure proper mechanical package design & procurement for an ELLIOTT GROUP rotating equipment package. Package design includes electric motor with switchgears/VSDs/transformers, gear boxes (incl. Vorecon), API614 oil system(incl. rundown tank) , seal gas system(dry gas seal console per API614/692) , surface condensers, gland condensers, condensate pumps(API610) with steam turbines(per API611), sealing steam unit, steam/gas strainers/traps/non return valves(NRVs), oil accumulators, process PSVs/PCVs, gas coolers, air compressor inlet filters/blow off silencers, oil/water injection units, etc. for technical issues.
In addition to these technical role, the Mechanical Engineer's is also responsible for the project schedules, budget, time management and communication with internally with other ELLIOTT GROUP teams and external customers.
The purpose of the position is to hire more advanced engineering and leadership experience to an individual with equivalent experience to an ENGINEER I,II ,III or IV Mechanical Engineer. The position will function primarily as a Mechanical Engineer for package design to achieve equitable and satisfactory execution of contracts, within project budgets and to project schedules on projects of limited complexity.
The position can also function as a support element to a more senior engineering staff member, who is functioning as Lead Engineer on a large or complex project. In the support role, the position will provide the Lead Engineer, with assistance to achieve the same equitable and satisfactory execution of contracts, within project budgets and to project schedules.
The position will also be responsible to fulfil the following:* Maintain an environment of professional and ethical conduct within ELLIOTT GROUP.
* Follow department process work standards and procedures to achieve best-in-class contract execution as a member of Project Engineering.
* Interface between the Project Engineer, suppliers and customers both internal and external.
* Develop technical, project management, and commercial capabilities, to allow for personal development and career growth.
* Promote a positive attitude for a safe and healthy work environment, as well as awareness for high quality products and services from Project Engineering group.
* Provide input as requested for continuous improvement of ELLIOTT GROUP processes.
* Develop and demonstrate leadership within Project Engineering.
* Provide engineering support as required to Project Engineering


BACKGROUND and EXPERIENCE* Bachelor of Engineering / Technology, or equivalent four-year academic qualification.
Minimum of typically two (2) to eighteen (18) years of experience, as a Mechanical Design Engineer or Turbomachinery Auxiliaries System Design Engineer or equivalent work experience.


NATURE OF THE JOB* The Mechanical Engineer functions as the primary resource for technical design and coordination regarding turbomachinery auxiliary system and mechanical equipment of ELLIOTT Group Turbomachinery package.
* The Mechanical Engineer also functions as the primary technical contact for sub-suppliers of Mechanical and Fluid systems related components to achieve contract execution.
* The principle daily activities of this job involve collecting and analysing detailed technical information, and effectively communicating that information regarding the assigned project to the appropriate organization. Responding to new or unfamiliar complex situations is a common experience, however, guidance and direction from others will still be required. This position will expose the individual to direct customer contact.
* The nature of the job is designed to further build upon the foundation of knowledge gained as an ENGINEER I or II or III Mechanical Engineer, or from previous equivalent work experience. Training for the position will be aimed at self-development of specialization in technical areas and begin to develop organizational leadership skills.
* The individual will be encouraged to further develop their individual contribution to the Project Engineering departmental goals, to the extent that activities covered by established policies or standard procedures can be successfully managed.
* Expected travel is around 10-30% typically.
* Additional work hours or temporary schedule adjustment may be required.


CONTACT WITH OTHERS
Contact with the following occurs on a regular basis:* Manager of Project Engineering Group
* Project Engineers
* Project Managers
* Controls COE (Centre of Excellence)
* Product Engineering COE
* Purchasing COE
* Project COE
* Sales
* Applications
* Business Development
* Other Departments as required.
* Contact with the following, will be directly supervised initially and continuously monitored by Manager of Project Engineering
* Clients, Potential Clients, End users, or Purchasers.
* Engineering Contractors,
* Third Party Engineering Firms,
* Client's suppliers with which technical information must be exchanged.
* Any Regulatory Agency
* Communications and contact is expected to be of a strictly technical nature. Communications regarding commercial or contractual obligations should be addressed only under the direction of the Supervisor of Project Engineering, Manager Project
* Engineering, Project Manager, or another ELLIOTT senior staff member.


SUPERVISION
Direction of other's work efforts will be required such as direction to design staff, junior engineers, and document control staff.
The individual may be asked to provide direction to intern, rotational engineer, ENGINEER I - Mechanical Engineer, ENGINEER II - Mechanical Engineer, ENGINEER III - Mechanical Engineer positions as mentoring or project relationships as required.* Demonstrated leadership ability.
* Demonstrated ability to manage sub-suppliers.
* Demonstrated ability provide quality customer service and support.
* Exhibits desire for continuous improvement, continuous education, training, and personal development.
* Possesses good basic work habits, promptness, and dependability.
* Self-directed worker, with good work ethic.
* Disciplined, able to follow directions and procedures.
* Maintains a professional and business-like behavior.
* Good communications skills, verbal, and written with a demonstrated ability to interface across different cultural lines.
* Ability to travel (Local & International).
* Excellent computer skills regarding Word, Excel, and Power Point. Able to operate proficiently with ELLIOTT Business
* Systems, Project Management (PM), and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems.
* Experience/Exposure to AutoCAD and 3D modelling software.
* Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a dynamic work environment.
* Developed time management skills, with an ability to balance demand among various projects.
* Preferred requirements: Turbo- machinery auxiliary systems, Mechanical Items and Equipment design engineering and procurement experience

  

SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES/COMPETENCIES
Continued building understanding of the ELLIOTT organization, its product lines, Project Engineering Group work procedures, and methods. The position requires the continued development in the area of Mechanical engineering with the expectation that the individual is to develop as a resource to the department in this area.* Continue building an understanding of industry related standards, such as API 612, 610, 614, 617, 670, 692, ASTM. Additionally, the position requires a sound understanding of other codes and standards frequently encountered in the petrochemical and oil and gas industries.
* Promote a positive attitude for a safe and healthy work environment, as well as awareness for high quality products and services from Project Engineering, in support of ELLIOTT GROUP management initiatives.
* Maintain an environment for professional and ethical conduct as directed by ELLIOTT corporate policies and ELLIOTT Code of Ethics.
* Review and analysis of customer specifications.
* Review, revision, and submittal of ELLIOTT GROUP internal design specification information.
* Creation of purchase requisitions for material procurement, including all supporting technical documentation
* Actively participate in Project Transfer Meetings (TM1 and TM2), manage transfer of project technical information from Proposal stage to Execution stage.
* Actively participate in key project meetings when required, including Kick Off Meeting (KOM), HAZOP meeting, Customer Coordination Meeting (CCM), Pre-Inspection Meeting (PIM) and Design Review Meetings (DRM).
* Facilitate major supplier meetings with client, and ELLIOTT personnel, including Kick Off Meeting (KOM), Customer
* Coordination Meeting (CCM), Pre-Inspection Meeting (PIM) and Design Review Meetings (DRM), with the assistance of the Project Manager.
* Correspondence, documents, and information to be submitted to the client for approval or record, through the Project Engineer.
* Provide due diligence in the retention of information sufficient to maintain adequate knowledge of the project for ‘downstream’ operations both internal and external to ELLIOTT GROUP.
* Ability to understand turbomachinery auxiliary systems and related equipment functionalities. Also, shall have ability procure same as external skids /items/equipment from external suppliers through purchase requisitions.
* Attend turbomachinery package 3D model reviews and provide technical assistance as Mechanical Engineer.
* Support and Lead in interpreting customer specifications and requisitioning components to meet those specifications.
* Full Mechanical design and procurement of Lube oil console as per API614 including equipment selection of Pump, Motors Filters, Accumulators, Rundown Tank, and Oil Mist Eliminator.
* Full Mechanical design and procurement of Dry Gas Seal Systems as per API692.


Review supplier documentation/calculations/ typical mechanical and general layouts drawings

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
**Job Summary**

Responsible for designing, defining, implementing system requirements, analyzing and/or testing Nordson products. Responsible for designing, testing, and implementing production methodology for new products. Responsible for providing design input to ensure manufacturing success of new products. Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors.


**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Coordinates subsystems and integration of total system and tooling.
* Identifies, analyzes and resolves program and production support deficiencies; Develops, recommends, and implements corrective actions and tracks progress of corrective actions as key inputs to program progress and/or production health.
* May conduct feasibility studies on new and modified designs.
* Runs Pilot production activities.
* Plans and conducts work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection and adaptation or modification of standard techniques, procedures and criteria, including production escalations.
* Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
* Devises new approaches to problems encountered.
* May direct support personnel in preparation of detailed design, design testing, prototype fabrication and manufacturing.
* Selects components and equipment based on analysis of specifications and reliability.
* May review vendor capability to support development.
* Other duties may be assigned as required.

**Education and Experience**

* Requires a BS Mechanical Engineering degree
5 – 8 years of experience or equivalent relevant experience.  
* 

**Skills and Abilities**

* Solidworks proficiency
* Familiar with ASME Y14.5M drawing standards
* Experience with a variety of metal fabrication methods, including Sheet Metal, Welding, Machining, and Plating.
* Ability to interface with a wide variety of personnel in group and one-on-one settings
* Strong teamwork and collaborative skills
* Experience with Lean
* Manufacturing in an OEM/Capital Equipment production environment preferred
* Proficient or advanced in Microsoft Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
* Project Management
* Understanding of RoHS and REACH compliance
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
* High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
* Ability to execute in a fast paced and dynamic environment

**Working Environment and Physical Demands**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


**Travel Required**

Estimated 10-20% Domestic and International

title: Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


With a team of around 4,000 employees present in more than 30 countries, GE Hydro Solutions helps customers accelerate the energy transition, by providing Hydropower Solutions to deliver more renewable energy to the world, in a reliable and sustainable way. From Services solutions to Pumped Storage, our portfolio includes the broadest range of hydro solutions and services. In the world, GE's Hydro turbines and generators represent more than 25% of the total installed capacity, and more than 30% of hydro storage plants are equipped with GE technology.  

  

We are fully committed to full gender equality and diversity inclusion, aiming for the best professionals in an equal employment opportunity environment.  

  

We strive to support work-life balance with flexible benefit programs and hybrid and remote work arrangements.  

  

  

  

Design of hydro governing system and its auxiliaries including its instrumentations; perform the related work under guidance of Principal /Lead Engineer for large hydro. Engineers have a role and responsibility to take up work with engineers and Designer too.**Job Description**
===================

**Essential Responsibilities**

* Safety (EHS) in Design
* Quality in design (FPY)
* Always keep track of OTDs and Ensure delivery of design documents on time as per master time schedule (MTS) and in allotted hours budget
* Analyze the contractual requirement of relevant scope of work and interfaces
* Prepare design documents following design practices and under guidance of Principal engineer/ system integrator.
* Validation of all basic and detail design work performed by engineers about all design reviews and related documentations.
* Assist Principal engineer engineer/ leader/ System integrator for carrying out all design reviews and related documentations
* Review and reply to customer/SI comments and update documents accordingly
* Communicate and maintain design interface sheets with other functions
* Prepare / validation of purchase specification of different systems and review of supplier offer/technical documents in co-ordination with supply-chain
* Co-ordinate with designers/ engineer and PDE team for elaboration of details design
* Prepare detail design documents and release them in ENOVIA
* Performing/Asist in performing inhouse loop testing of governor panels and governor OPU
* Co-ordinate with supplier quality team as and when required
* Co-ordinate with construction and commissioning team as and when required
* Occasional site visit/trouble-shooting
* Perform technical support to Supply Chain and manufacturing follow-up
* Finish the tasks assigned by Manager/Lead engineer within time.

**Qualifications / Requirements**

* Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical/electrical/electronic Engineering from reputed university or Diploma with good relevant experience
* Total years of experience should range between 5- 8 years
* Should have good knowledge of hydraulic P&IDs of hydro governors
* Should have knowledge of functional understanding of HP compressors, governor OPU, MIV OPU, their instrumentation, Turbine and MIV instrumentation, unit operating sequences, etc.
* Should have good knowledge to perform Oil/Air Piping in 3D and 2D software, Exposure to BIM is desirable.
* Functional knowledge of digital governing system (PID controls), their standard features, regional grid requirements, FGMO/RGMO, etc. is desirable.
* Should be acquainted with main design/sizing criteria of governing equipment and relevant international standards
* Should be able to check documents and guide engineers/designers to perform electrical wiring diagrams of governor panel, marshaling boxes, local control cubicles, cable list
* Should be acquainted with relevant IEC/IEEE standard of hydro governing system
* Should be acquainted with different ASME/ISO/DIN standard used in industry
* Good knowledge of AutoCAD and MS-office

**Desired Characteristics**

* Willingness to work cross-discipline, i.e., for both hydraulic as well as electrical part of governing system
* Willingness to support small hydro team/services team/technical tendering team as and when required
* Good English ability, fluently communication in listening, speaking, reading and writing as well as understanding for working
* Continuous improvement mindset
* Team-player, positive & engaged contributor to the team, willingness to learn & adapt to business needs
* Pro-activeness, sense of urgency, autonomy
* Open to change
* Positive attitude & approach
* Good interpersonal skills
* Independent, self-starter
* Able to operate in multi-disciplinary environment
* Cross cultural communication sensitivity
* Learning aptitude
* Able to work in Global Organization
* Travel to site/Customer place as required

title: Designer
description:
The position will be based in India and be part of the System Design team of Sidel Greater Middle East, Africa & India (MEAI). The incumbent will be in charge of preparing the line design from precontracting/proposal stage up to completion/execution, including developing the initial layout and the detailed engineering layouts in execution stage, designing the complete line layouts and ensuring the correct integration of Sidel and third party equipment, including conveying specifications and accumulation profiles. The incumbent will also be tasked to prepare electrical distribution drawings for low voltage, as well as network layouts for line communication.


### **Your Mission**


Line Layouts  

* Determining the required conveyor components and performing the necessary calculations to prepare a pre-contracting layout as per the request received from the Project Manager Proposal within the required timeframe.
* Validation of pre-contracting layout, engineering and costing.
* Analysis and validation of customer specifications (type of motors, chains, bearings, lubrication, etc.).
* Onsite measurements and customer meetings (with Complete Line PM).
* Line dimensioning and accumulation calculations.
* Integration of all the equipment of the line into the layout, in accordance with safety, ergonomics and efficiency requirements.
* Liaise with Sidel conveyors manufacturing sites for the conveyors supply.
* Prepare and distribute technical specifications required for the conveyors and line operation.
* Prepare all documents related to line execution, including but not limited to Line general layout, Floor specifications, drainage plans, installation and positioning layout.


Electrical – Pre-Contracting  

* Analysis of conveyors automation specifications/requirements
* Quotation of conveyors automation specifications/requirements
* Prepare a complete offer for Conveyor Control Panel and conveyors wiring
* Prepare a complete offer for Main distribution panel and power wiring
* Possibility of meeting with the customer


Electrical - Execution  

* Execution of Complete Project for cable and duct of complete Line
* Execution of network layout and IP assignments to all controllers in the line.
* Supply to Sidel Conveying of all the necessary information for the study of conveyor software and electrical components
* Possibility of meeting with the customer

### **Your Profile**


Minimum requirements  

* Technical Competences in beverage lines or comparable industrial systems.
* Knowledge of CAD environment (Autocad).
* Knowledge of conveying systems and associated concepts.
* Understanding and utilisation of engineering technical terminology.
* Fundamental understanding of mechanical and assembly drawings.
* Basic knowledge of mechanical engineering technologies and manufacturing processes.
* Knowledge of electrical distribution systems (LV)
* Knowledge of industrial automation and communication protocols.
* Ability for short-term business trips globally.


Additional requirements  

* Knowledge of SAP ERP management software
* Understanding of electrical diagrams
* Knowledge of civil engineering
* Knowledge of fluid dynamics
* Programming experience
* Basic knowledge of mechanical and chemicals properties of the industrial materials.


Relevant Experience  

* Working experience as a designer in a conveyor manufacturer company.
* Knowledge of processes within the beverage industry.


Qualifications  

* Technical diploma or University degree in mechatronics/automation engineering.
* Knowledge of CAD environment (Autocad).
* Knowledge of Sidel specificities and beverage industrial environment.
* Software proficient (DAO, ERP, GDT, Excel).
* Linguistic competences: fluent English, French is a plus.

###### **Contract Type**


###### **Permanent**


###### **Country**


###### **INDIA**


###### **Location**


###### **Gurgaon**

title: Principal
description:
**Vantive: A New Company Built On Our Legacy**


Baxter is on a journey to spin off our ~$5B Kidney Care segment into a standalone company. Vantive\\* will build on our nearly 70-year legacy in acute therapies and home and in-center dialysis to provide best-in-class care to the people we serve. We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us.


At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don’t settle for the mediocre. Each of us are driven to help improve patients’ lives worldwide. Join us as we revolutionize kidney care and other vital organ support.

* Completion of the proposed separation of Kidney Care from Baxter into a standalone company (to be named Vantive) remains subject to the satisfaction of customary conditions.


**About Baxter**

Baxter provides a broad portfolio of essential renal and hospital products, including home, acute and in-centre dialysis; sterile IV solutions; infusion systems and devices; parenteral nutrition; surgery products and anesthetics; and pharmacy automation, software and services. The company’s global footprint and the critical nature of its products and services play a key role in expanding access to healthcare in emerging and developed countries. Baxter’s employees worldwide are building upon the company’s rich heritage of medical breakthroughs to advance the next generation of healthcare innovations that enable patient care.


**Job Summary**

* **Job Title – Principal Eng, Mechanical**
* **Location – Whitefield, Bangalore**
* **Shift – General**

**Job Responsibilities**

* + Mechanical discipline leads assigned projects. Manages all mechanical project technical work, and effectively communicates with all project team members and stakeholders. This includes reporting pertinent information at key milestones.
	+ Defines the required mechanical tasks, test plans, deliverables, and technical direction. Constructs detailed, accurate project schedules interfacing with product development, quality, and manufacturing teams.
	+ Manages and prioritizes multiple projects and tasks.
	+ Develops solutions and approaches to complex problems through the application and adaptation of state-of-the-art techniques and sound analysis-based engineering including FEA and experimental tools and methods.
	+ Able to present moderately complex concepts and tailor communication to audiences, including senior management.
	+ Ensures successful integration of mechanical design elements into the overall system. Resolves competing constraints between interrelated functions (engineering, purchasing, manufacturing, regulatory, marketing, etc.) required to complete the engineering and design tasks.
	+ Creates and maintains design documentation that includes requirements and specifications, engineering reports, and detailed drawings for engineering and manufacturing purposes, including dimensioned layouts with special fits and tolerances.
	+ Performs in-depth analyses and calculations including structural, tolerance, load and fatigue life, thermal, and heat transfer to ensure consistent performance.
	+ Defines protocols and conducts the necessary testing required to verify and validate the design(s).
	+ Leads troubleshooting and problem-solving efforts related to mechanical aspects of the products associated with field performance and manufacturing.

**Qualifications**

* + Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent (master’s degree preferred)
	+ Minimum 8-15 years of experience in new product development, and sustenance and have at least participated in one project from concept to market introduction demonstrating experience.


Hands-on expereince in plastic injection molding technology and tool room exposure is preffered.

* Experience in a regulated industry, preferably medical devices, and familiarity with ISO 13485, IEC 60601, and ISO 14971.
* Proficiency with MS Office and other office productivity tools.
* Clear and effective communication (written and oral) and presentation skills.
* Extensive experience with Solidworks.
* Demonstrated experience working on electromechanical systems and with external 3rd party contract manufacturers and component suppliers.
* A proven track record of effectiveness in a fast-paced environment.
* Proven ability to create results within budget, timeline, and product/project deliverables.

**Skills**

* Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent knowledge of SolidWorks 3D design software, and additionally good ProE/Creo familiarity preferred.
* Solid computer skills: email, documentation and collaboration tools: e.g. WebEx, Teams, Microsoft Office products, etc.
* Self-directed, resourceful, and able to manage multiple projects and priorities.
* Strong organization, attention to detail, and documentation skills.
* Expert in managing project work and providing technical leadership.
* Very adept at grasping and solving complex problems using root-cause analysis techniques.
* Expert knowledge of mechanical part manufacturing processes including injection molding, sheet metal fabrication, casting and machining.
* Strong knowledge of design processes including DFM and DFA.
* Expert knowledge of good engineering drawing practices supported by a strong understanding of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.
* Very knowledgeable & experienced with analysis methods and tools like FEA.
* Hands on creating, developing and testing designs from prototypes through production implementation.
* Ability to objectively identify technical solutions, and make sound design and drafting decisions.
* Able to effectively transition products to manufacturing and ensure robust products and manufacturing processes.
* Ability to identify risks in design, programs & come up with mitigation plan.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Senior R&D Engineer
description:
**Location:**Hyderabad, IN
**Employment type:** Employee
**Place of work:** Office
**Offshore/Onshore:** Onshore
TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.


Job Purpose
* Will work in Qualification Test lab for Pressure and load testing of Subsea & Surface products per specified industry standards

**Department:**
* REMS – Hyderabad.
Job Description
**RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Executes and supports Product Qualification testing activities as Test Engineer.
* Serves as a technical point of contact for assigned work package scope and as a focal point for all communications related to scope.
* Develops Lab product/tool design, geometry standards documentation for product qualification requirements.
* Creates, reviews and approves part reports, drawings, engineering specifications and standards.
* Creates, reviews and approves the test reports (RPTs) to adhere to the customer requirements and internal standards
* Closely works with quality engineer, product engineer, buyer, project manager and all associated stakeholders.
* Supports and manage qualification project schedule and deliverables.
* Provides management with technical assistance and work progress updates as requested.
* Mentors and provides technical guidance to Technicians. Works collaboratively to accomplish project tasks. Provides independent review of work packages.
* Mentors and provides technical guidance to junior test engineers and develops them into reviewers and approvers
* Provides vendors technical assistance and builds strong working relationships.
* Executes qualification per the requirements of industry code related to subsea production systems, TechnipFMC standards and client specifications, following the test procedures.
* Adheres to all relevant safe work instructions and design guidelines, Clearly demonstrates creativity and innovation in finding solutions and alternatives for shop floor issues and troubleshooting
* The role is responsible for executing activities assigned by the manager, and execute it with the assigned team.
You are meant for this job if:
* Degreed Mechanical Engineer with at least 6/8-years of Engineering/qualification testing experience in the Subsea Production System engineering, reduced to 4/5-years for Masters candidates.
* Demonstrated experience in supporting qualification projects constrained by safety, quality, delivery, and cost requirements.
* Experience in creating and reviewing Test procedures, test reports, documents, layouts, safety work plans and interpreting results of test.
* Work experience to include experience with various ASME, API, NORSOK, and DNV Codes and Standards as it relates to subsea equipment design and manufacturing.
* Exposure to various manufacturing processes - forging, hot and cold extrusion, cladding, HIP, induction bending etc
* Exposure to welding codes and practices - ASME IX and API 1104.
* Exposure to NDE codes and practices - UT, PAUT, PT, RT, MPI per ASME V.
* Accuracy, dependability, ability to manage schedule and prioritize work for self and others in team.
* Ability to work independently and as a part of a technical team - a self-motivated, self-starter.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English with ability to effectively transfer subject matter expertise. Ability to coach and mentor others.

We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.**

title: Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


With a team of around 4,000 employees present in more than 30 countries, GE Hydro Solutions helps customers accelerate the energy transition, by providing Hydropower Solutions to deliver more renewable energy to the world, in a reliable and sustainable way. From Services solutions to Pumped Storage, our portfolio includes the broadest range of hydro solutions and services. In the world, GE's Hydro turbines and generators represent more than 25% of the total installed capacity, and more than 30% of hydro storage plants are equipped with GE technology.  

  

We are fully committed to full gender equality and diversity inclusion, aiming for the best professionals in an equal employment opportunity environment.  

  

We strive to support work-life balance with flexible benefit programs and hybrid and remote work arrangements.

activity like Review and get approval of above system documents and


drawings from client.
