title: Junior Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================

**Job Description**
===================

**Job Description Summary**


Performing operations related to Aerospace assembly components. Accountable for the quality of own work. Subject to direct operations supervision/prescribed work instructions/systems checking. Executes within a well-defined operations framework. There is generally a step-by-step sequence of standard operational tasks which need to be followed to achieve a result.

**Essential Responsibilities:**

* Diploma in mechanical engineering with minimum of 2-3 years’ experience in Aviation Tubes and Ducts, Fabrication Industry.
* Shall have experience in fabrication & fasteners assembly. Capable of validating and ensuring customer specification compliance, knowing GE, RR, Boeing requirements will be an added advantage.
* Shall have experience in assembly process. Capable of establishing different riveting, insulations, inserts, links, clips assemblies.
* Shall have experience in drawing evaluation and providing inputs essential for assembly process establishment.
* Ability to analyse defects, identify root causes and provide efficient solution and implement CAPA.
* Basic knowledge of stainless steel and Inconel tube and sheet fabrication in aviation industry.
* Working experience with GE Aviation P Specifications.
* Ensure that manufacturing procedures follow safety and environmental regulations.
* Must be familiar with EHS practices inside workshop as well as on site.
* Responsible for FAI prove outs and creating new assembly procedures/MOS’s for the same.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Should Have Minimum of 2-3 years’ hands on experience in aerospace assembly components.
* Should have good communication and interpersonal skill.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to document, execute new assemblies.
* Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn
* Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candour, contributes constructively
* Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes work, committed
* Problem solver: analytical-minded, challenges existing processes, critical thinker.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Fire Engineer
description:
We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than **75 000** people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.


**Job Title**


 Discipline Engineer – Fire & Smoke

  


 **Purpose of the Job/Objective**


* Perform Fire & Smoke analysis & documents in accordance with QCD commitments Apply the Alstom processes & instruction

  




**Organisation Reporting**


* **Hierarchical:** Domain leader – Specialized disciplines


**Functional:**


 TPM or TDE for tender/project support, as per the project organisation

  


**Network & Links**


* Core Competence Network (CCN) fire and smoke: CCN Leader Fire Safety, FS Engineers from other sites
* Site Engineering: Design Engineers, mechanical engineers, industrialization, Train Design Engineer (TDE), Train Performance Manager (TPM), Train Architect Manager (TAM), Train System Engineer (TSE), Train Sub System Manager/Engineer, TSS RAMS Managers, Project Certification Manager (PrCM)
* Project: Project Engineering Manager (PrEM), Project Operation Manager (PrOM)
* Products: Product architects (PA), Product managers (PM)
* Industrial: Project Industrial Manager (PrIM),
* Industrial Quality: Industrial Quality Manager,
* QSRW: Project Quality and Safety Manager (PrQSM), Supplier Product Quality Development (SPQD)
* Sourcing: Buyers, and SPQD team
* Integrating & Participating Units: Fire & Smoke specialists, RAMS leaders, WP owners
* External Interface: External Suppliers, External Laboratories for F&S tests, Customers, Fire & Smoke Authorities, External Auditors

  




**Responsibilities**

  


* At tender phase, analyze the requirement and provide the compliance status. Highlight any risks and provide optimized costing.
* At project execution stage, deliver Fire & Smoke analysis (Fire & Smoke Report, test monitoring…) compliant with QCD work packages commitments.
* At product development stage, set the relevant targets depending on the applicable standards and regulations and customers targeted, for internal development (make) and external (COS).
* Assure the right deployment (standards, tests, simulations…) for covering Fire & Smoke requirements at design/manufacturing level. Pilot the use of database MADAM.
* Apply Alstom processes within the Group.
* Support the deployment of processes, methodologies, simulations, and available fire safety data management (ReX) and storage tools Raise an issue at N+1 in case of gaps / abnormality /incompliancy
* Participate to relevant DR and GR meeting to ensure Fire and Smoke performance conformity

  




**Knowledge & Experience :**

  


* Fire & Safety or Mechanical or Materials Engineering degree,
* At least 2 years of experience in R&D, Design in Aeronautical, Automotive, Manufacturing or Railways engineering department within.
* Good Communications and interpersonal skills Time Management skills Sense of priorities Customer Focus Structured and pro-activity, team working, strategic vision
* Implement relevant Fire and Smoke R&D results in projects
* Basic knowledge on mechanical conception and CAD software (Catia preferred)
* Management skills to lead tender/project and R&D actions with a transversal approach
* English conversational/writing/reading advanced level
* Skill to read and interpret standards, and to lead design-reviews and propose solutions.


**Team size :** NIL



An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.

  

  

**Job Segment:** Testing, Product Development, Database, Technology, Research

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than **75 000** people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.


**Job Title**


* MLE - Mechanical Lead Engineer (Interior & CAB)

  




**Purpose of the Job**


* Managing Interior & CAB Domain resources, activities and deliverables on a project in compliance with QCD commitments.
* Ensuring implementation of Train Design metier instructions, processes & tools in all activities and deliverables.

  




**Organisation Reporting**


* Hierarchical Reporting: (Site) Interior & CAB Domain Leader (DL)
* Functional Reporting: (Project) Train Design Engineer (TDE)

  




**Accountable for :**


* Planning and piloting Interior & CAB Domain activities and related deliverables on project considering applicable instructions/processes and other specific Customer (internal or external) requirements.
* Ensuring Interior & CAB Domain deliverables quality and their acceptance by the Customer (internal or external) within committed limits.
* Reporting activities progress and alerting relevant N+1 in case of issue potentially impacting achievement of QCD commitments.
* Planning and managing activities and resources with changing environment of project inputs to ensure QCD targets and right first time.
* Aligning requirements and mechanical interfaces of equipment (Allocated volume, weight, location, preferred part list etc.) with cross functional teams.
* Demonstrate standard engineering practices (example: material selection, Tolerance stack up, Location strategy, perceived quality, knowledge of manufacturing, serviceability, assembly, LCC, DFMEA) during design reviews.
* Monitoring flow of Train level requirements to subsystems for optimum cost-effective solutions and confirming requirements through appropriate validation.
* Lead Design reviews with cross functional teams to demonstrate implementation of metier process, instructions and project requirements.
* Monitoring assigned Mechanical Sub-Systems deliveries conformity with project QCD needs.
* Demonstrate process rigor to ensure first time right through engineering practices and methodologies and reviews
* Represent domain in project meetings to communicate ensure seamless integration of project and domain operations.

  




**Responsible for :**

* Applying TD rules, processes and tools (single-domain) and ensuring Interior & CAB Domain deliverables quality and their acceptance by the Customer (internal or external) within committed limits
* Managing production of deliverables in accordance with planning targets on Domain assigned work-packages by right planning, cross functional information management and engineering rigor.
* Designing products considering project requirements (performances, manufacturability, serviceability, testability, etc.).
* Leading domain Design Reviews according to project schedule to demonstrate excellence in engineering and following-up the main open actions.
* Checking respect of Allocated volumes/interfaces (no-clashes) on internal design.
* Defining mitigation plans covering a risk identified on Project Mechanical Domain scope.
* Reporting on Mechanical Domain activities progress, anticipating issues (capacity, skills, rule applicability, etc.) and alerting if needed.
* Respecting and/or allocating requirements and mechanical interfaces to Sub-Systems/equipment (Allocated volume, weight, location, Preferred part list, etc.)
* Coordinating Mechanical Domain contributors on Project.
* Analysing and consolidating change request impacts on Mechanical Domain scope
* Monitor Domain deliverables (Requirement management in DOORs tool, Validation Plan, design deliveries, design reviews, Co-engineering with cross functional teams etc.)
* Validating relevant Mechanical Domain deliverables and securing planning.
* Identify and expedite requirement of mock-ups or simulations through organization process.

  




**Contributor for :**


* Defining mitigation plans covering a risk identified on Project Mechanical (multi-domains)
* Perform quotation of engineering work-package, upon request
* Defining Project Mechanical Decomposition (Product Breakdown Structure)
* Defining Mechanical Project/Product Preferred Part List delivery.
* Supporting Sourcing, Industrialization and Manufacturing teams during Production ramp-up.
* Collaborating with DL for continuous improvement of the Domain (including Return of Experience)
* Defining Mechanical Domain architecture considering weight, gauge, installation strategy, acoustics, eco design, ergonomics, aerodynamics, aeraulic etc.
* Establishing Certification & Validation Plans for TD scope.

  


**Knowledge & Experience**


* Mechanical Engineering graduate preferably experienced in Railway products with 10 to 14 years of rich design, development and team management exposure.
* Good Communications and interpersonal skills including with third parties (customer).
* Time management and reporting skill.
* Effort estimation and planning skills
* Sense of urgency / priority.
* Customer & Product Focus.
* Risk management
* Strong technical background with knowledge of RS commodities
* Structured and organised with Hands-on approach.
* English operational in read/writing and technical meetings.
* Knowledge of Foreign language (ex. French, German.. etc) shall be favourable.

  




**Team size**


* Direct functional reporting: 4 to 12 persons
* Depending on the project size, the scope of accountability represents a workload of up to 20 full time equivalents (with subcontracting)

An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.

  


  

**Job Segment:** Risk Management, Finance

title: Survey Engineer
description:
Survey Engineer


Location: Mumbai , Maharashtra , India  

  

  

Description


We are looking for a fulltime Survey Engineer for our field operations in India. The Survey Engineer shall plan, prepare, execute, supervises and evaluates the entire ILI survey with all required activities and act as the main on-site customer service representative. Besides good technical knowledge suitable candidate shall also have a flexible and customer orientated attitude.
  

**Responsibilities will include the following, but not limited to:**
  

* Checking of all survey information for completeness.
* Verifying tool capability against Technical Questionnaire and Selecting and specifying the required equipment and its configuration in close co-operation and agreement with the Project Manager.
* Performing HSE risk assessment onsite.
* Perform onsite visits and briefings with clients to clarify all inspection run circumstances, if needed.
* Oversee entire survey execution, including managing critical decision-making process.
* Lead the entire operation onsite during ILI survey which includes managing the crew and interacting with client
* Maintain assigned tool sheet via preventative and corrective maintenance to include complete preparation and refurbishment of the ILI tools and preparing and assembling the electronic equipment and setting tool parameters in accordance to drawings, parts lists, manuals etc.
* Data processing and preparing of inspection survey data set for delivery to data evaluation.
* Detect and validate classified features and location and sizing of anomalies.
* Checking all equipment for completeness and correct function, in order to ensure that the equipment fulfills the job requirements as specified.
* Ordering parts as required.
* Checking and testing all mechanical and electronic components of assigned tools Creating and adapting the required documentation
* Decide on all tool/equipment related subjects in accordance to project’s objectives.
  

  

Requirements


* Technical background e.g. Mechanical Engineering or similar;
* 2-3 years’ work experience in a similar position, preferably in the Oil & Gas industry;
* Should have competencies like Analytic thinking, Conflict handling, strategic thinking and problem solving, Proactive/Self-starter;
* Team player with leadership skills, capable to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels;
* Good communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills within an international enviorement;
* Ability to perform activities in a result-oriented manner and work effectively to meet tight deadlines;
* Affinity with computers and knowledge of standard MS office software;
* Excellent communication skills in English (verbally and in writing);
* Willingness to travel for long durations at remote locations across the country;
* Go getter with decision making skills to execute site jobs with limited resources;
* Strong focus on HSE.
  

  

Our Offer


ROSEN offers an exceptional working environment, salary commensurate with experienceand an incredible benefits package.Interested? please send your motivation letter and CV to Mr. Ganesh Kamble at **Gkamble@rosengroup.com** or apply online.  

  

  

Who we are


ROSEN is a leading privately owned company that was established as a one-man business in 1981. Over the last decades, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a worldwide technology group that operates in more than 120 countries with over 4,200 employees.  

ROSEN is an extended team of people with a passion for technology and innovation. “empowered by technology” is the key to our sophisticated and highly innovative products and services to the oil and gas and other engineering industries. The focus of all our research efforts and high tech solutions is on a safe operation of assets and therefore provide protection for both people and the environment.
We are always looking for young professionals as well as experienced employees. Our tremendous and ongoing organic growth results in manifold career opportunities and gives our employees chances for further development and added experience.  

More information about the ROSEN Group under www.rosen-group.com.
Contact


  

Ganesh Kamble

title: Senior Environmental Engineer
description:
**Requisition ID: 275137**

* **Relocation Authorized: International - Accompanied**
* **Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project**
* **Work Location: Various Permanent Bechtel Office Locations**

**Bechtel:**


Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place.


Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact.


We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations.


Core to Bechtel is our Vision, Values and Commitments. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver

 **The Project:**


Bechtel is seeking to work with a major Indian corporation to provide Project Management Consultant (PMC) Services and Engineering Procurement and Construction Management (EPCM) Services for offsites and utilities (OSBL) for a multi-billion-dollar upgrade / expansion of their existing petrochemical facilities in India. The PMC Services will be led out of India with personnel deployed in Mumbai region, the project sites in India, as well as several key contractor locations across India. The EPCM Services for OSBL will be led out of Bechtel’s India offices.

  

You will bring your experience and expertise to the PMC role while working within the customer’s organization as part of an integrated team. As part of this team, you will commit to supporting the client’s goals while promoting our values of fairness, diversity, inclusion, trust, and collaboration guided by our Vision, Values and Commitments.

 **Position Summary**


Excellent career growth opportunity for a technically strong environmental engineer seeking a new challenge in a fast-paced environment.


Responsible for assigned activities within environmental engineering discipline on the project. Applies broad and diversified knowledge of environmental engineering principles and practices to the project. Makes decisions independently concerning problems within the environmental discipline on the project. Represents the environmental discipline on the project with Contractors and Owner to resolve technical questions and as required to coordinate work.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Oversee and monitor Contractors’ engineering progress in environmental discipline and reports to project management.
* Review the design scope and deliverables of environmental discipline to ensure Contractors perform all work to agreed standards for safety, health and environment.
* Coordinate with other leaders within the project organization to ensure that multi-discipline interfaces are properly addressed with resolution of technical issues in a timely manner.
* Coordinate and participate in reviews of Contractors’ engineering documents/deliverables within environmental discipline to ensure compliance with the contract requirements, including project procedures, project specifications and applicable codes and standards. Monitor status of Contractor documents reviews for environmental discipline.
* Actively participate in design reviews and HAZOP, HAZID/ENVID, etc. studies.
* Work with other PMC lead discipline engineers to ensure that all interfaces between disciplines are clearly defined and recorded.
* Promote the creation of a work environment supported by leadership which fosters openness, trust, communication, teamwork, empowerment, innovation and satisfaction.
* Participate in project technical reviews, progress and review meetings.
* Prepare environmental engineering deliverables relating to regulatory compliance, air emissions and water/wastewater treatment.
* Prepare, coordinate, and review designs, studies, reports and proposals.
* Take the initiative to coordinate the design development of a system with other engineering disciplines while managing workload and meeting schedule due dates.
* Show knowledge of and perform standard discipline engineering activities on projects with minimal technical oversight.
* Interface with overall project team and client on a regular basis showing excellent communication skills.

**Responsibilities**

* Review of and input to OSBL environmental engineering scope including water & industrial wastewater treatment, process flow diagrams, equipment datasheets and drainage philosophy.
* Review of and input to Licensor deliverables including equipment datasheets, effluent and emission summaries and drawings.
* Ensure that project is compliant with federal and state environmental legislation and regulations.
* Review permit material for air and effluent emission compliance.
* Compile technical lists and inventories such as emissions and effluents summaries including calculations as required.
* Deliver excellent quality work, showing thoroughness and rigour in checking and attention to detail.

**Qualifications and Skills**

**Basic Qualifications**

**Essential:**


The following are considered as prerequisites for this role:

* Hold a recognized degree in environmental, chemical/process or mechanical engineering from an accredited college or university.
* Display excellent knowledge of technical theory, engineering principles, good engineering practices and how to apply them for design execution.
* Demonstrate ability to work independently with minimal supervision showing a high degree of professionalism.
* Have familiarity with major regulations and industry codes and standards affecting standard design, quality, or processes.
* Be a Chartered Engineer (or equivalent) or shows willingness to complete.
* Have experience in EPC industry and with large-scale project execution.
* Have experience as previous PMC / Owners’ Engineer.

**Desirable:**


Any of the following experience is considered as important for this role:

* Previous Chemical or Petrochemical experience.
* Previous experience of working in India.
* Expertise in assessing of air emissions from industrial sources.
* Expertise in designing of water/industrial wastewater systems.
* Experience of managing 3rd party contractors for ESIA/EIA, air dispersion modelling, effluent dispersion modelling, etc.

***Shaping tomorrow together***

***Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.***  

***www.bechtel.com***

***Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.***

***In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.***

title: Cfd Engineer
description:
**Job Description:**

An ANSYS Application Engineer with a focus on Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) plays a crucial role in applying ANSYS software solutions to address complex engineering challenges related to fluid dynamics. The job description may include the following responsibilities and qualifications:

**Key responsibilities:**

* Utilize ANSYS software, particularly in the CFD domain, to solve engineering problems related to fluid flow, heat transfer, and related phenomena.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to software functionality, installation, and usage.
* Collaborate with the customer support team to address and resolve escalated technical issues.
* Assist the sales team in pre-sales activities by conducting product demonstrations and presentations.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in Finite Element Analysis, with expertise in using ANSYS software products.
* Knowledge of CAD software for geometry preparation and mesh generation (e.g., ANSYS SpaceClaim, ANSYS Meshing, or similar tools).
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Previous experience in a customer-facing role or technical support is a plus.
* Demonstrated use of relevant Ansys software or knowledge of other commercial CAE, CAD, EDA, PLM software packages added advantage.

title: Maintenance Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** Maintenance Technician - Molding Machines and Plant Equipment
  
  

**Company:** Laxmi Electronics Thru Raveone Consultants.
  
  

**Location:** Bangalore, India
  
  

**About Us:**  

Laxmi Electronics is a leading manufacturing company specializing in [mention the industry]. We pride ourselves on innovation, quality, and reliability in all aspects of our operations. As part of our commitment to excellence, we are seeking a skilled Maintenance Technician to join our team and ensure the smooth operation of our molding machines and plant equipment.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

As a Maintenance Technician at Laxmi Electronics, you will be responsible for performing preventive and breakdown maintenance on molding machines and various plant equipment. You will play a critical role in ensuring the continuous and efficient operation of our production processes. The role will involve working with a variety of equipment, including DG sets, compressors, chillers, cranes, pump houses, cooling towers, and other essential machinery.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

1. Conduct preventive maintenance tasks on molding machines and plant equipment according to established schedules to minimize downtime and ensure optimal performance.
  
  

2. Diagnose and troubleshoot equipment malfunctions, performing repairs promptly to minimize production disruptions.
  
  

3. Coordinate with production teams to schedule maintenance activities, ensuring minimal impact on production schedules.
  
  

4. Perform routine inspections of machinery and equipment to identify potential issues and address them proactively.
  
  

5. Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including work performed, parts used, and equipment status.
  
  

6. Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to procure spare parts and materials as needed for maintenance activities.
  
  

7. Adhere to safety protocols and procedures at all times to maintain a safe working environment for yourself and others.
  
  

8. Assist in the installation, commissioning, and decommissioning of machinery and equipment as required.
  
  

9. Keep abreast of industry trends and best practices in equipment maintenance to continuously improve maintenance processes and efficiency.
  
  

10. Participate in training programs and workshops to enhance technical skills and knowledge related to equipment maintenance.
  
  

High school diploma or equivalent qualification; technical certification or vocational training in mechanical or electrical engineering preferred.

title: Associate Engineer
description:
**What you’ll do:**
-------------------



If you desire to be part of something special, to be part of a winning team, to be part of a fun team – winning is fun. We are looking forward tohire **Associate Engineer - CDE (FEA) – Mobility** in **Pune, India.** In Eaton, making our work exciting, engaging, meaningful; ensuring safety, health, wellness; and being a model of inclusion & diversity are already embedded in **who we are - it’s in our values, part of our vision, and our clearly defined aspirational goals. This exciting role offers opportunity to**:


* Eaton India Innovation Center (EIIC) – Center for Digital Engineering (CDE) has an Associate Engineer open position.
* The primary responsibility of this role is to analyse various Eaton's Mobility products for static and vibration FEA analysis domains like stress, deformation, fatigue and modal/harmonic vibration.
* Individual will be required to partner with global and local teams, understand the design intent, develop and validate static and vibration structural FEA analysis models to substantiate the engineering designs.
* The primary functions for this position includes:
* Collaborates with technology and product teams to define problem statements.
* Understand product & evaluate requirements (CTQs) of system, sub-systems and components in cooperation with internal and external customers.
* Deployment of digital prototype methodologies in static and vibration structural FEA analysis (stress, deformation, fatigue, modal, Harmonics & random vibration FEA analysis.)
**Qualifications:**
-------------------



Requirement:

* Bachelor in Mechanical, Automotive, Production Engineering
* Less than 2 years of relevant experience with multinational engineering organization/Fresh Graduate (BE/B.Tech) from reputed college can also apply
* Basic engineering fundamentals' understanding on topics like Strength of Materials and Vibrations, and its application in Mechanical design
* Knowledge about various Automotive product lines & its architecture, Understanding of subsystem or components
* Fundamental understanding of various Finite Elements Methods (FEM) and tools, example Ansys, Abaqus etc.
* Experienced in projects involving FEA / CAE analysis skills.
* Excellent English communication (oral and written) and presentation skills
* Team player with highly effective interpersonal and collaboration skills
* Good learning agility with energy and zeal to deliver beyond expected results.
* Good Communication & articulation skills, Collaborating with local and global stakeholders, learning agility, drive and energy.
**Skills:**
-----------


* Coordinate with stakeholders to develop static and vibration structural FEA analysis requirements for Eaton's Mobility products.
* Interpret, summarize and communicate static and vibration structural FEA results (stress, deformation, fatigue, modal, Harmonics & random vibration FEA analysis) to local and global audience and provide technical and/or design recommendations.
* Support validation for maturing analysis capability of static and vibration structural FEA.
* Support test plan wherever necessary to verify simulation model and validate analysis approach in correlation with test outcomes.
* Understand product function and architecture indepth and collaborate closely with product and test team.

title: Mechanical Engineer - Continuous Improvement (Senior to Staff)
